      36             : 
      37             : /*
      38             : Buffer used to contain the characters of a macro being defined, and the
      39             : characters of macro expansions.
      40             : */
      41             : static char     *macro_buffer;
      42             :                         /* Contains characters of macro expansions and of
      43             :                            macro definitions.  Dynamically allocated,
      44             :                            expanded as needed. */
      45             : #define MACRO_BUFFER_INITIAL_ALLOCATION 4000
      46             :                         /* Initial allocation size for macro_buffer.  The
      47             :                            initial allocation should be such that almost all
      48             :                            cases can be accepted (so that the realloc is
      49             :                            hardly ever needed).  Subsequent reallocations will
      50             :                            double the amount previously allocated. */
      51             : static char     *after_end_of_macro_buffer;
      52             :                         /* The address just past the last element of
      53             :                            macro_buffer. */
      54             : static char     *next_avail_in_macro_buffer;
      55             :                         /* Next character position in macro_buffer available
      56             :                            for allocation.  Reset at the start of a macro
      57             :                            definition or a top-level macro expansion.  Not
      58             :                            set outside of macro processing. */
      59             : static sizeof_t num_compacted_macro_buffer_chars;
      60             :                         /* Number of characters in macro_buffer that have
      61             :                            already been compacted as a result of previous
      62             :                            reallocations.  Except for cases where source line
      63             :                            modifications are inserted in this region because
      64             :                            of rescanning, these characters cannot be compacted
      65             :                            further and, as an optimization, can thus just be
      66             :                            memcpy'ed during further macro_buffer
      67             :                            reallocations. */
      68             : static sizeof_t num_chars_deleted_in_macro_buffer;
      69             :                         /* Number of characters in the uncompacted portion of
      70             :                            macro_buffer that have been logically deleted via
      71             :                            source line modifications. */
      72             : static char     *macro_buffer_region_in_progress;
      73             :                         /* If non-NULL, points to the start of a section at
      74             :                            the end of macro_buffer that is in the process of
      75             :                            being built incrementally (e.g., by proc_define).
      76             :                            Set by begin_macro_buffer_region() and by
      77             :                            release_macro_buffer_region().  This allows the
      78             :                            region to be copied by expand_macro_buffer, even
      79             :                            though the region is not associated with a source
      80             :                            line modification at the time that macro_buffer is
      81             :                            reallocated. */
      82             : static a_const_char
      83             :                 *discarded_pcc_top_level_begin,
      84             :                 *discarded_pcc_top_level_end;
      85             :                         /* Delimit the region of the macro buffer
      86             :                            containing the top-level expansion being
      87             :                            replaced by expand_top_level_pcc_macro.  Valid
      88             :                            only during the period when the macro buffer may
      89             :                            be expanded for copying the contents of the
      90             :                            auxiliary buffer.  Allows expand_macro_buffer to
      91             :                            verify that any orphaned source line
      92             :                            modifications are being legitimately
      93             :                            abandoned. */
      94             : #if FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS
      95             : static a_macro_text_map
      96             :                 macro_text_map;
      97             :                         /* Map from text in macro_buffer to the original
      98             :                            source locations from which the text came, i.e.,
      99             :                            from the macro definition or macro argument.  Like
     100             :                            macro_buffer, this is cumulative for an entire
     101             :                            logical source line; each source line modification
     102             :                            will refer to a subset of the map entries to
     103             :                            describe the offsets in its inserted_text portion
     104             :                            of macro_buffer.  (Note that the offsets in entries
     105             :                            in macro_text_map are relative to the beginning of
     106             :                            the inserted text of the associated source line
     107             :                            modification, not to the beginning of
     108             :                            macro_buffer.)  Also like macro_buffer, this data
     109             :                            structure is used for both macro definitions and
     110             :                            expansions. */
     111             : #define MACRO_TEXT_MAP_INITIAL_COUNT 500
     112             :                         /* Initial number of map entries for macro_text_map.
     113             :                            The initial allocation should be such that almost
     114             :                            all cases can be accepted (so that the realloc is
     115             :                            hardly ever needed).  Subsequent reallocations will
     116             :                            double the number of entries previously
     117             :                            allocated. */
     118             : #endif /* FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS */
     119             : 
     120             : #if RECORD_MACRO_INVOCATIONS
     121             : static a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr
     122             :                 last_macro_invocation_record_block;

     124             :                            containing the record with the largest index so
     125             :                            far. */

     127             :                 ckpt_last_macro_invocation_record_block;
     128             :                         /* Shadow copy of preceding for checkpoint/revert. */
     129             : static a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr
     130             :                 saved_next_macro_invocation_record_block;
     131             :                         /* If reverting a macro invocation moves
     132             :                            last_macro_invocation_record_block to the
     133             :                            preceding block, the newly-emptied block is
     134             :                            pointed to by this so it can be reused for

     136             : static a_macro_invocation_record_index

     139             :                            so far. */

     156             :                            macro_invocation function,

     158             :                            account macro invocations occurring during the

     162             :                         /* Shadow copy of preceding for checkpoint/revert. */

     167             :                            macro expansion so that the token pasting can
     168             :                            match pcc's. */

     303             :                            expand_top_level_pcc_macro when that routine is
     304             :                            active; NULL otherwise. */
     305             : 
     306             : /*
     307             : Maximum nesting depth of calls of a single macro in pcc mode.  Used to
     308             : catch recursion, but crudely, because a general recursion check is
     309             : probably NP-complete.  The test will generate an error in some cases
     310             : that involve deep nesting but no recursion, as for example in
     311             :   #define x(a) a
     312             :   x(x(x(x(x(x(x(x(x(x(x(x  ... etc ... (1))))))))))))
     313             : */
     314             : #define MAX_PCC_RECURSIVE_MACRO_DEPTH 300
     315             : 
     316             : /*
     317             : Declaration for the data structure used to hold values of
     318             : arguments to macro calls.
     319             : */
     320             : typedef struct a_macro_arg *a_macro_arg_ptr;
     321             : 
     322             : typedef struct a_macro_arg {
     323             :   a_macro_arg_ptr
     324             :                 next;
     325             :                         /* Pointer used when this macro arg is freed
     326             :                            and placed on an avail list. */
     327             :   sizeof_t      raw_len;
     328             :                         /* Length of the raw version of the argument, in
     329             :                            raw_text, not counting the final LE_END_OF_INSERTION
     330             :                            lexical escape. */
     331             :   char          *raw_text;
     332             :                         /* The raw version of the argument text.  Dynamically
     333             :                            allocated, expanded as needed.  Contains various
     334             :                            escapes (e.g., end-of-token) in addition to the
     335             :                            raw text of the tokens. */
     336             : #define ARG_RAW_TEXT_INITIAL_ALLOCATION 400
     337             :                         /* Initial allocation size for raw_text.  The initial
     338             :                            allocation should be such that almost all cases
     339             :                            can be accepted (so that the realloc is hardly ever
     340             :                            needed).  Subsequent reallocations will double the
     341             :                            amount previously allocated. */
     342             :   sizeof_t      raw_alloc_len;
     343             :                         /* Allocated size of the raw_text array. */
     344             :   char          *initial_raw_text_not_in_primary_source_line;
     345             :                         /* If non-NULL, points to the first character of the
     346             :                            source for the argument when it comes from a
     347             :                            macro expansion rather than the primary source line.
     348             :                            This is useful to have because it preserves the
     349             :                            context needed to determine macro inertness. */
     350             :   a_source_line_modif_ptr
     351             :                 final_modif_for_initial_text;
     352             :                         /* If initial_raw_text_not_in_primary_source_line is
     353             :                            non-NULL, this points to the source line
     354             :                            modification from which the rescan returns to the
     355             :                            primary source line, if any, or NULL if the scan
     356             :                            never returns to the primary source line. */
     357             :   sizeof_t      offset_in_raw_text_of_primary_source_line_text;
     358             :                         /* Offset of the first character in raw_text that
     359             :                            comes from the primary source line.  Non-zero
     360             :                            only if initial_raw_text_not_in_primary_source_line
     361             :                            is non-NULL, and indicates the point at which we
     362             :                            return to the primary line.  If we never return
     363             :                            to the primary source line, this is the offset
     364             :                            of the LE_END_OF_INSERTION escape at the end
     365             :                            of the raw_text. */
     366             :   sizeof_t      expanded_len;
     367             :                         /* Length of the expanded version of the argument, in
     368             :                            expanded_text, not counting the final
     369             :                            LE_END_OF_INSERTION lexical escape. */
     370             :   char          *expanded_text;
     371             :                         /* The macro-expanded version of the argument text.
     372             :                            Dynamically allocated, expanded as needed.
     373             :                            Contains various escapes (e.g., end-of-token) in
     374             :                            addition to the raw text of the tokens. */
     375             : #define ARG_EXPANDED_TEXT_INITIAL_ALLOCATION 800
     376             :                         /* Initial allocation size for expanded_text.  The
     377             :                            initial allocation should be such that almost all
     378             :                            cases can be accepted (so that the realloc is
     379             :                            hardly ever needed).  Subsequent reallocations will
     380             :                            double the amount previously allocated. */
     381             :   sizeof_t      expanded_alloc_len;
     382             :                         /* Allocated size of the expanded_text array. */
     383             : #if FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS
     384             :   a_macro_text_map
     385             :                 raw_text_map;
     386             :                         /* A map of offsets within raw_text to the original
     387             :                            positions (macro definition and arguments) from
     388             :                            which they came. */
     389             :   a_macro_text_map
     390             :                 exp_text_map;
     391             :                         /* A map of offsets within expanded_text to the
     392             :                            original positions (macro definition and arguments)
     393             :                            from which they came. */
     394             : #define MACRO_ARGUMENT_TEXT_MAP_INITIAL_COUNT 10
     395             :                         /* Initial number of map entries for raw_text_map and
     396             :                            exp_text_map.  The initial allocation is kept low
     397             :                            to reduce overall memory usage: most macro
     398             :                            invocations tend to have only a few tokens per
     399             :                            argument, and deeply-nested invocations can result
     400             :                            in the allocation of many a_macro_arg entries, so
     401             :                            it's best to start small and extend only those maps
     402             :                            where the extra entries are actually needed. */
     403             :   a_source_position
     404             :                 comma_pos;
     405             :                         /* Position of the terminating comma;
     406             :                            null_source_position if this is the last
     407             :                            argument. */
     408             : #endif /* FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS */
     409             :   a_byte_boolean
     410             :                 is_empty_arg;
     411             :                         /* The Microsoft preprocessor distinguishes between
     412             :                            omitted and empty arguments.  Both have a
     413             :                            raw_len of 0, but an empty argument is preceded
     414             :                            or followed by a comma -- e.g., for a
     415             :                            two-argument macro, M(a) has an omitted second
     416             :                            argument, while M(,) has two empty arguments.
     417             :                            This affects how stringizing works: a stringized
     418             :                            empty argument produces "", while a stringized
     419             :                            omitted argument produces nothing. */
     420             : } a_macro_arg;
     421             : 
     422             : static a_macro_arg_ptr
     423             :                 avail_macro_args;
     424             :                         /* List of freed macro arguments available for
     425             :                            reuse. */
     426             : static a_macro_arg_ptr
     427             :                 macro_arg_list,
     428             :                 end_of_macro_arg_list;
     429             :                         /* All the a_macro_arg entries currently being used. */
     430             : 
     431             : static a_const_char
     432             :                 *arg_get_token_start_of_curr_token;
     433             :                         /* Set by arg_get_token to point to the position
     434             :                            after the white-space skip.  This differs from
     435             :                            the value returned in start_of_curr_token when
     436             :                            the token is preceded by an inert-macro escape. */
     437             : 
     438             : static unsigned long
     439             :                 macro_name_modif_seq;
     440             :                         /* During the execution of macro_invocation, this
     441             :                            is the sequence id of the source line
     442             :                            modification containing the name of the macro
     443             :                            being expanded, or 0 if the macro name appears
     444             :                            directly in the source code.  This is used by
     445             :                            arg_get_token to distinguish between commas that
     446             :                            appear directly in the macro argument list and
     447             :                            those appearing in expansions of macro
     448             :                            arguments. */
     449             : 
     450             : static a_boolean
     451             :                 single_param_macro;
     452             :                         /* During the execution of macro_invocation, this
     453             :                            will be TRUE if and only if the macro being
     454             :                            expanded is a function-style macro with exactly
     455             :                            one parameter.  This is used by arg_get_token to
     456             :                            determine whether a Microsoft-mode "magic" comma
     457             :                            should be suppressed or included. */
     458             : 
     459             : #if DEBUG
     460             : static unsigned long
     461             :                 num_macro_params_allocated,
     462             :                 num_macro_defs_allocated,
     463             :                 num_macro_args_allocated,
     464             :                 macro_arg_text_space,
     465             :                 param_name_string_space,
     466             :                 macro_definition_space;
     467             :                         /* Used to track space use. */
     468             : #endif /* DEBUG */
     469             : 
     470             : static a_const_char
     471             :                 *end_of_cpp_string;
     472             :                         /* When preprocessing in cpp-compatibility mode,
     473             :                            the insides of character constants and string
     474             :                            literals in macro definitions are examined for
     475             :                            parameter names.  This is implemented here by
     476             :                            actually tokenizing the insides of strings.
     477             :                            When this flag is non-NULL, we are inside a
     478             :                            string, and it points to the closing quote
     479             :                            character. */
     480             : static a_const_char
     481             :                 *start_of_white_space_in_cpp_string;
     482             :                         /* When end_of_cpp_string is non-NULL, this
     483             :                            is set by mdefn_get_token to the start of any
     484             :                            white space skipped before the current token,
     485             :                            or to NULL on the pseudo-token for the opening
     486             :                            quote of the string. */
     487             : 
     488             : 
     489             : static a_symbol_ptr
     490             :                 date_macro_symbol,
     491             :                 time_macro_symbol;
     492             :                         /* Pointers to the symbol entries for the special
     493             :                            macros "__DATE__" and "__TIME__". */
     494             : 
     495             : 
     496             : #if FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS
     497             : /*
     498             : Declaration for the data structure used to track the mapping from source
     499             : positions to target offsets in a buffer that is built incrementally by
     500             : copying one token at a time.  When active, these are kept in a singly-linked
     501             : list to allow updates to the offsets being tracked if macro_buffer reallocation
     502             : results in compaction of a source line modification that is being scanned.
     503             : */
     504             : typedef struct a_text_map_position_tracker *a_text_map_position_tracker_ptr;
     505             : 
     506             : typedef struct a_text_map_position_tracker {
     507             :   a_text_map_position_tracker_ptr
     508             :                 next_active_tracker;
     509             :                         /* Pointer to the next active position tracker, or NULL
     510             :                            if none. */

     513             :                            line modification inserted text) at which the
     514             :                            current region begins. */

     551     1268490 : void init_macro_text_map(sizeof_t             num_entries,
     552             :                          a_macro_text_map_ptr mtmp,
     553             :                          a_boolean            resizable)
     554             : /*
     555             : Initialize a macro text map object with room for num_entries macro text map
     556             : entries.  If resizable is TRUE, the space will be allocated so that the array
     557             : can be extended to accommodate more entries; otherwise, it will be allocated
     558             : in front-end memory so it can be saved in a precompiled header.
     559             : */
     560             : {
     561     1268490 :   if (num_entries != 0) {
     562      253428 :     if (resizable) {
     563             :       /* The map can grow -- use alloc resizable_buffer. */
     564        1804 :       mtmp->entries = (a_macro_text_map_entry_ptr)alloc_resizable_buffer(
     565             :                        (sizeof_t)(num_entries*sizeof(a_macro_text_map_entry)));
     566             :     } else {
     567             :       /* The map is fixed size -- use alloc_fe. */
     568      251624 :       mtmp->entries = (a_macro_text_map_entry_ptr)alloc_fe(
     569             :                        (sizeof_t)(num_entries*sizeof(a_macro_text_map_entry)));
     570             :       }  /* if */
     571             :   } else {
     572             :     /* No entries for now (i.e., will probably be just a reference to entries
     573             :        that are part of another text map). */
     574     1015060 :     mtmp->max_entries = 0;
     575     1015060 :     mtmp->entries = NULL;
     576             :   }  /* if */
     577     1268490 :   mtmp->max_entries = num_entries;
     578     1268490 :   mtmp->num_entries = 0;
     579     1268490 :   mtmp->resizable = resizable;
     580     1268490 : }  /* init_macro_text_map */

     583     5229870 : static void ensure_avail_text_map_entries(a_macro_text_map_ptr mtmp,
     584             :                                           sizeof_t             num_entries)
     585             : /*
     586             : Make sure that the text map designated by mtmp has at least num_entries free
     587             : map entries, extending the array of entries if necessary.
     588             : */

     590     5229870 :   if (mtmp->num_entries + num_entries > mtmp->max_entries) {
     591             :     /* The entry array is full; double (at least) the size (implicitly copying
     592             :        the previous contents). */

     679             : static void clone_macro_text_map_entries(
     680             :                           a_macro_text_map_ptr            src_map,
     681             :                           sizeof_t                        starting_src_offset,
     682             :                           sizeof_t                        src_region_len,
     683             :                           a_macro_text_map_ptr            targ_map,
     684             :                           sizeof_t                        starting_targ_offset,
     685             :                           a_macro_invocation_record_index macro_context)
     686             : /*
     687             : Copy the range of macro text map entries in the region designated by
     688             : starting_src_offset and src_region_len from src_map to targ_map, adjusting
     689             : the offsets appropriately.  If RECORD_MACRO_INVOCATIONS is TRUE, the
     690             : macro_context of the positions in the new text map entries will be set to
     691             : the value specified by macro_context unless it has the value
     692             : NO_PARENT_MACRO_INVOCATION; in that case, the macro_context value from the
     693             : source entry will be preserved.

     695             : {
     696             :   a_macro_text_map_entry_ptr      mtmep;
     697             :   a_macro_invocation_record_index ctx = macro_context;
     698             :   a_column_number                 adjusted_column;

     700             :   /* Call bsearch to find the macro text map entry that covers the specified
     701             :      source buffer starting offset. */

     706             :                                      sizeof(a_macro_text_map_entry),
     707             :                                      compare_macro_text_map_entry_with_offset);

     709             :                        "offset not found");

     711             :   if (macro_context == NO_PARENT_MACRO_INVOCATION) {
     712             :     /* Copy the context from the source entry. */
     713             :     ctx = mtmep->macro_context;
     714             :   }  /* if */
     715             : #endif /* RECORD_MACRO_INVOCATIONS */
     716             :   if (mtmep->corresponding_source_pos.seq == 0) {
     717             :     /* Don't change the column number -- it's a special flag, not an actual
     718             :        column number. */
     719             :     adjusted_column = mtmep->corresponding_source_pos.column;
     720             :   } else {
     721             :     /* The first map entry requires special treatment because we may only be
     722             :        cloning a part of its region, i.e., the source buffer starting offset
     723             :        might not correspond to the starting location of the map entry,

     759      638879 : static void init_text_map_position_tracker(
     760             :                                 a_text_map_position_tracker_ptr  tmpt,
     761             :                                 a_macro_text_map_ptr             text_map,
     762             :                                 a_macro_invocation_record_index  macro_context)
     763             : /*
     764             : Add the specified position tracker to the list of active trackers and
     765             : initialize it with the offset of the current token as target offset 0 and
     766             : referring to the specified macro text map.  If macro_context is
     767             : NO_PARENT_MACRO_INVOCATION, the context from any cloned entries will be
     768             : preserved; otherwise, the specified context will be saved in newly-created
     769             : text map entries.

     772      638879 :   a_const_char *adj_start_of_curr_token = start_of_curr_token;

     781             :          its parent or the source line, as appropriate, for tracking. */

     807             : 
     808             : static void add_token_part_to_macro_text_map(
     809             :                              a_text_map_position_tracker_ptr tmpt,
     810             :                              a_const_char                    *token_part_start,
     811             :                              a_source_position               *token_part_pos,
     812             :                              a_boolean                       force_new_region,
     813             :                              sizeof_t                        next_targ_offset)
     814             : /*
     815             : This routine is called for each token or portion of a token that is to
     816             : be added to a buffer with which a macro text map is associated.  It updates
     817             : the macro text map pointed to by tmpt->text_map to reflect copying the
     818             : current token into the target buffer at next_targ_offset and makes any
     819             : necessary adjustments to the state information in *tmpt.  token_part_start
     820             : points to the start of the token or portion thereof.  token_part_pos is
     821             : the source position of token_part_start.  force_new_region is TRUE if a new
     822             : text map entry must be created.
     823             : */
     824             : {
     825             :   sizeof_t     rel_src_offset = 0;
     826             :   sizeof_t     rel_targ_offset;
     827             :   a_boolean    new_region_required = FALSE;
     828             :   a_const_char *adj_start_of_curr_token = start_of_curr_token;
     829             : 
     830             :   if (tmpt->src_slmp != NULL) {
     831             :     /* Previous tokens were from the inserted text of a source line
     832             :        modification. */
     833             :     a_boolean in_curr_slmp = ptr_in_range(token_part_start,
     834             :                                           tmpt->src_slmp->inserted_text,
     835             :                                           tmpt->src_slmp->end_inserted_text);
     836             :     if (force_new_region) {
     837             :       new_region_required = TRUE;
     838             :     } else if (!in_curr_slmp) {
     839             :       /* If the new token is not part of the inserted_text of the source line
     840             :          modification from which the previous tokens came, we need a new
     841             :          region. */
     842             :       new_region_required = TRUE;
     843             :     } else {
     844             :       /* Check to see if the new token will be at the same relative offset in
     845             :          the target as it was in the source; if not, we need a new region. */
     846             :       rel_src_offset = token_part_start -
     847             :               tmpt->src_slmp->inserted_text - tmpt->src_region_starting_offset;
     848             :       rel_targ_offset = next_targ_offset - tmpt->targ_region_starting_offset;
     849             :       new_region_required = (rel_src_offset != rel_targ_offset);
     850             :     }  /* if */
     851             :     if (new_region_required) {
     852             :       /* The new token will not be covered by the range of the current map
     853             :          entry -- clone the src_slmp map entries and set up for the new
     854             :          token. */
     855             :       clone_macro_text_map_entries(&tmpt->src_slmp->text_map,
     856             :                                    tmpt->src_region_starting_offset,
     857             :                                    tmpt->src_region_len, tmpt->text_map,
     858             :                                    tmpt->targ_region_starting_offset,
     859             :                                    tmpt->macro_context);
     860             :       if (!in_curr_slmp) {
     861             :         /* Release the associated source line modification and switch to
     862             :            the new one, if any. */
     863             :         --tmpt->src_slmp->num_active_position_trackers;
     864             :         if (!within_curr_source_line(token_part_start)) {
     865             :           tmpt->src_slmp = assoc_source_line_modif(token_part_start);
     866             :           if (tmpt->src_slmp->is_whitespace_kwd) {
     867             :             /* This is the canonical representation of a whitespace keyword,
     868             :                which has no map.  Use the location of the original text of
     869             :                the keyword. */
     870             :             if (token_part_start == tmpt->src_slmp->inserted_text) {
     871             :               token_part_start = loc_of_insert(tmpt->src_slmp);
     872             :             } else {
     873             :               check_assertion(token_part_start ==
     874             :                                         tmpt->src_slmp->end_inserted_text - 1);
     875             :               token_part_start = loc_of_insert(tmpt->src_slmp) +
     876             :                                        tmpt->src_slmp->num_chars_to_delete - 1;
     877             :             }  /* if */
     878             :             adj_start_of_curr_token = loc_of_insert(tmpt->src_slmp);
     879             :             tmpt->src_slmp = parent_source_line_modif(tmpt->src_slmp);
     880             :           }  /* if */
     881             :         }  /* if */
     882             :       }  /* if */
     883             :       if (within_curr_source_line(token_part_start)) {
     884             :         /* We fell out of the source line modification back to the original
     885             :            source line. */
     886             :         tmpt->src_region_starting_offset = token_part_start - curr_source_line;
     887             :         tmpt->src_slmp = NULL;
     888             :         tmpt->starting_pos.seq = token_part_pos->seq;
     889             :         tmpt->starting_pos.column = token_part_pos->column;
     890             :       } else {
     891             :         /* We're still in a source line modification. */
     892             :         if (!in_curr_slmp) {
     893             :           /* We entered or re-entered a different source line modification
     894             :              from the one we were in. */
     895             :           ++tmpt->src_slmp->num_active_position_trackers;
     896             :         }  /* if */
     897             :         tmpt->src_region_starting_offset = token_part_start -
     898             :                                                  tmpt->src_slmp->inserted_text;
     899             :       }  /* if */
     900             :       tmpt->targ_region_starting_offset = next_targ_offset;
     901             :       rel_src_offset = 0;
     902             :     }  /* if */
     903             :   } else {
     904             :     /* Previous tokens were from the current source line. */
     905             :     a_boolean in_same_source_line =
     906             :                                within_curr_source_line(token_part_start) &&
     907             :                                tmpt->starting_pos.seq == token_part_pos->seq;
     908             :     if (force_new_region) {
     909             :       new_region_required = TRUE;
     910             :     } else if (!in_same_source_line) {
     911             :       /* If the new token is not part of the same source line from which the
     912             :          previous tokens came, we need a new region. */
     913             :       new_region_required = TRUE;
     914             :     } else {
     915             :       /* Check to see if the new token will be at the same relative offset in
     916             :          the target as it was in the source; if not, we need a new region. */
     917             :       rel_src_offset = token_part_start - curr_source_line -
     918             :                                               tmpt->src_region_starting_offset;
     919             :       rel_targ_offset = next_targ_offset - tmpt->targ_region_starting_offset;
     920             :       new_region_required = (rel_src_offset != rel_targ_offset);
     921             :     }  /* if */
     922             :     if (new_region_required) {
     923             :       /* The new token will not be covered by the range of the current map
     924             :          entry -- step to a new entry. */
     925             :       add_entry_to_macro_text_map(tmpt->text_map,
     926             :                                   tmpt->targ_region_starting_offset,
     927             :                                   tmpt->starting_pos.seq,
     928             :                                   tmpt->starting_pos.column,
     929             :                                   tmpt->macro_context);
     930             :       if (within_curr_source_line(token_part_start)) {
     931             :         /* The new token is still in the current source line. */
     932             :         tmpt->src_region_starting_offset = token_part_start - curr_source_line;
     933             :         tmpt->starting_pos.seq = token_part_pos->seq;
     934             :         tmpt->starting_pos.column = token_part_pos->column;
     935             :       } else {
     936             :         /* We've entered a source line modification. */
     937             :         tmpt->src_slmp = assoc_source_line_modif(token_part_start);
     938             :         ++tmpt->src_slmp->num_active_position_trackers;
     939             :         tmpt->starting_pos.seq = 0;
     940             :         tmpt->starting_pos.column = SP_COL_UNKNOWN;

     942             :                                                  tmpt->src_slmp->inserted_text;

     955             : 
     956     1376990 : static void add_token_to_macro_text_map(
     957             :                               a_text_map_position_tracker_ptr tmpt,
     958             :                               sizeof_t                        next_targ_offset)
     959             : /*
     960             : This routine is called for each token to be added to a buffer with which a
     961             : macro text map is associated.  It calls add_token_part_to_macro_text_map
     962             : for the start of the token and again for the character following any
     963             : multibyte character in the token.
     964             : */
     965             : {
     966     1376990 :   add_token_part_to_macro_text_map(tmpt, start_of_curr_token, &pos_curr_token,
     967             :                                    /*force_new_region=*/FALSE,
     968             :                                    next_targ_offset);
     969             : #if MULTIBYTE_CHARS_IN_SOURCE_SUPPORTED
     970             :   /* Check if this token is in the source line and contains multibyte
     971             :      characters.  (The offset calculations for multibyte characters
     972             :      appearing in source line modifications have already been reflected in
     973             :      the source text map entries that will be cloned for this token and
     974             :      should not be repeated.)  The only token shorter than three characters
     975             :      that can contain a multibyte sequence is an identifier. */
     976             :   if (multibyte_chars_in_source_enabled &&
     977             :       within_curr_source_line(start_of_curr_token) &&
     978             :       (end_of_curr_token - start_of_curr_token > 2 ||
     979             :        curr_token == tok_identifier)) {
     980             :     a_source_position     token_part_pos = pos_curr_token;
     981             :     a_const_char          *ptr = start_of_curr_token;
     982             :     /* Step through the characters of the token. */
     983             :     for (;;) {
     984             :       int numch = mbc_length_simple(ptr);
     985             :       ptr += numch;
     986             :       /* Stop when we reach the end of the token.  If the last character of
     987             :          the token is a multibyte character a new region will be forced
     988             :          elsewhere for the token that follows (if any). */
     989             :       if (ptr > end_of_curr_token) break;
     990             :       next_targ_offset += numch;
     991             :       /* The column number is only incremented for each logical character. */
     992             :       token_part_pos.column++;
     993             :       if (numch > 1) {
     994             :         /* A multibyte character was found.  Start a new text map entry for
     995             :            the character that follows. */
     996             :         add_token_part_to_macro_text_map(tmpt, ptr, &token_part_pos,
     997             :                                          /*force_new_region=*/TRUE,
     998             :                                          next_targ_offset);
     999             :       }  /* if */
    1000             :     }  /* for */
    1001             :   }  /* if */
    1002             : #endif /* MULTIBYTE_CHARS_IN_SOURCE_SUPPORTED */
    1003      441225 : }  /* add_token_to_macro_text_map */

    1094             : 
    1095             : #if RECORD_MACRO_INVOCATIONS
    1096           0 : a_macro_invocation_record_ptr macro_invocation_record_at_index(
    1097             :                                          a_macro_invocation_record_index index)
    1098             : /*
    1099             : Return a pointer to the macro invocation record with the specified index
    1100             : (NULL if the index is out of the range of existing macro invocation records).
    1101             : 
    1102             : At the end of front-end processing, when the number of entries is known, the
    1103             : list of macro invocation record blocks is transformed into a binary tree to
    1104             : allow for relatively-efficient random access.  Until that point, however, the
    1105             : blocks are simply maintained on a doubly-linked list, and only a pointer to
    1106             : the tail of the list is kept.  This is acceptable because the only indexed
    1107             : access to the list is in the case of diagnostic output, which does not need
    1108             : to be especially efficient, and even then the messages will usually refer to
    1109             : the most recent macro invocations, near the tail of the list.  In cases where
    1110             : no diagnostic output is needed, balancing the tree once at the end of
    1111             : processing is more efficient than maintaining a balanced tree throughout the
    1112             : growth of the list.
    1113             : */
    1114             : {
    1115           0 :   a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr mirbp;
    1116           0 :   a_macro_invocation_record_ptr       mirp = NULL;
    1117           0 :   int                                 index_in_block;
    1118             : 
    1119           0 :   if (index >= 0 && index < num_macro_invocation_records) {
    1120           0 :     for (mirbp = last_macro_invocation_record_block;
    1121           0 :          mirbp != NULL && mirbp->first_record_in_block > index;
    1122           0 :          mirbp = mirbp->prev) {}
    1123           0 :     index_in_block = index - mirbp->first_record_in_block;
    1124           0 :     mirp = mirbp->records + index_in_block;
    1125             :   }  /* if */
    1126           0 :   return mirp;
    1127             : }  /* macro_invocation_record_at_index */
    1128             : 
    1129             : 
    1130             : static void checkpoint_macro_invocation_record(void)
    1131             : /*
    1132             : Save state variables to allow reestablishing the current macro invocation
    1133             : record, in case a macro invocation in progress needs to be canceled.  See
    1134             : revert_macro_invocation_record.
    1135             : */
    1136             : {
    1137             :   ckpt_last_macro_invocation_record_block = last_macro_invocation_record_block;
    1138             :   ckpt_num_macro_invocation_records = num_macro_invocation_records;
    1139             :   ckpt_depth_of_curr_macro_invocation_record =
    1140             :                                          depth_of_curr_macro_invocation_record;
    1141             :   ckpt_max_macro_invocation_depth = max_macro_invocation_depth;
    1142             : }  /* checkpoint_macro_invocation_record */
    1143             : 
    1144             : 
    1145             : static void revert_macro_invocation_record(void)
    1146             : /*
    1147             : Restore the list of macro invocation records to its state before the current
    1148             : invocation was registered, reflecting the cancellation of the most recent
    1149             : macro invocation.
    1150             : */
    1151             : {
    1152             :   /* Make sure a previous state was checkpointed. */
    1153             :   check_assertion(ckpt_last_macro_invocation_record_block != NULL);
    1154             :   if (ckpt_last_macro_invocation_record_block !=
    1155             :                                           last_macro_invocation_record_block) {
    1156             :     /* Registering the most recent invocation overflowed into a new block.
    1157             :        Roll back to the previous one, saving the current block for later
    1158             :        reuse. */
    1159             :     saved_next_macro_invocation_record_block =
    1160             :                                             last_macro_invocation_record_block;
    1161             :     last_macro_invocation_record_block =
    1162             :                                        ckpt_last_macro_invocation_record_block;
    1163             :   }  /* if */
    1164             :   num_macro_invocation_records = ckpt_num_macro_invocation_records;
    1165             :   depth_of_curr_macro_invocation_record =
    1166             :                                     ckpt_depth_of_curr_macro_invocation_record;
    1167             :   max_macro_invocation_depth = ckpt_max_macro_invocation_depth;
    1168             :   /* Ensure that this function cannot be called twice without an intervening
    1169             :      call to register_macro_invocation. */
    1170             :   ckpt_last_macro_invocation_record_block = NULL;
    1171             : }  /* revert_macro_invocation_record */

    1212             : 
    1213             : static a_macro_invocation_record_index register_macro_invocation(
    1214             :                                 a_macro_invocation_record_index parent_index,
    1215             :                                 unsigned long                   stack_depth,
    1216             :                                 a_macro_def_ptr                 mdp,
    1217             :                                 a_source_position_ptr           macro_name_pos,
    1218             :                                 a_macro_invocation_record_ptr   *mirpp)
    1219             : /*
    1220             : Add an entry to the list of macro invocation records, reflecting the invocation
    1221             : of the macro indicated by mdp.  parent_index gives the index of the macro
    1222             : invocation record in whose expansion the current invocation begins or
    1223             : NO_PARENT_MACRO_INVOCATION if the invocation occurs directly in source text
    1224             : (invocations in an argument to a given macro are treated as if they occurred in
    1225             : the expansion of that macro).  stack_depth is the depth of the invocation
    1226             : stack after pushing the current invocation (i.e., it will always be at least
    1227             : 1), and macro_name_pos gives the position of the macro name in this macro
    1228             : invocation.  The return value is the index of the newly-added record, and
    1229             : *mirpp is set to point to that record, as well.
    1230             : */
    1231             : {
    1232             :   a_macro_invocation_record_ptr mirp;
    1233             : 
    1234             :   /* Save the current state to allow reverting in case the current invocation
    1235             :      is canceled. */
    1236             :   checkpoint_macro_invocation_record();
    1237             :   mirp = next_macro_invocation_record();
    1238             :   if (depth_of_curr_macro_invocation_record > 0 &&
    1239             :       stack_depth < depth_of_curr_macro_invocation_record - 1) {
    1240             :     /* In order to make a tree-like traversal of the invocation records easier,
    1241             :        whenever a transition reflects popping more than one stack level, we
    1242             :        must add a placeholder record reflecting the number of levels popped in
    1243             :        the transition. */
    1244             :     mirp->parent_macro_index = stack_depth -
    1245             :                                          depth_of_curr_macro_invocation_record;
    1246             :     mirp->assoc_macro = NULL;
    1247             :     mirp = next_macro_invocation_record();
    1248             :   }  /* if */
    1249             :   mirp->parent_macro_index = parent_index;
    1250             :   mirp->assoc_macro = mdp->macro;
    1251             :   /* Record the original location of the macro name in this invocation. */
    1252             :   mirp->start.seq = macro_name_pos->orig_seq;
    1253             :   mirp->start.column = macro_name_pos->orig_column;
    1254             :   if (stack_depth > max_macro_invocation_depth) {
    1255             :     max_macro_invocation_depth = stack_depth;
    1256             :   }  /* if */
    1257             :   depth_of_curr_macro_invocation_record = stack_depth;
    1258             :   *mirpp = mirp;
    1259             :   return num_macro_invocation_records - 1;
    1260             : }  /* register_macro_invocation */

    1262             : #if MACRO_INVOCATION_TREE_IN_IL
    1263             : 
    1264        4195 : static a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr create_macro_inv_record_tree(
    1265             :                          a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr mirbp,
    1266             :                          a_macro_invocation_record_index     first_record,
    1267             :                          a_macro_invocation_record_index     after_last_record)
    1268             : /*
    1269             : Recursively arrange the list of macro invocation record blocks containing the
    1270             : indices first_record through after_last_record-1 into a binary tree and return
    1271             : the address of the root block.  mirbp is a pointer to an arbitrary macro
    1272             : invocation record block.
    1273             : */
    1274             : {
    1275        4195 :   unsigned long                   num_blocks_in_tree;
    1276        4195 :   unsigned long                   num_blocks_in_left_subtree;
    1277        4195 :   a_macro_invocation_record_index first_record_in_root_block;
    1278             : 
    1279        4195 :   if (mirbp != NULL) {
    1280        4195 :     num_blocks_in_tree = (after_last_record - first_record + 
    1281        4195 :                           MACRO_INVOCATION_RECORDS_PER_BLOCK - 1)
    1282        4195 :                          / MACRO_INVOCATION_RECORDS_PER_BLOCK;
    1283        4195 :     num_blocks_in_left_subtree = num_blocks_in_tree/2;
    1284        4195 :     first_record_in_root_block = first_record +
    1285             :                num_blocks_in_left_subtree * MACRO_INVOCATION_RECORDS_PER_BLOCK;
    1286             :     /* mirbp might point either before or after the root block, so we need both
    1287             :        of the following loops to find it. */
    1288        7608 :     while (mirbp->first_record_in_block < first_record_in_root_block) {
    1289        3413 :       mirbp = mirbp->next;
    1290             :     }  /* while */
    1291        9983 :     while (mirbp->first_record_in_block > first_record_in_root_block) {
    1292        5788 :       mirbp = mirbp->prev;
    1293             :     }  /* while */
    1294             :     /* Recursively create subtrees. */
    1295        4195 :     if (num_blocks_in_left_subtree != 0) {
    1296        2375 :       mirbp->left_subtree =
    1297        2375 :                       create_macro_inv_record_tree(mirbp, first_record,
    1298             :                                                    first_record_in_root_block);
    1299             :     }  /* if */

    1301        1500 :       mirbp->right_subtree =
    1302        1500 :                create_macro_inv_record_tree(mirbp,
    1303        1500 :                                             mirbp->next->first_record_in_block,
    1304             :                                             after_last_record);

    1306             :   }  /* if */
    1307        4195 :   return mirbp;
    1308             : }  /* create_macro_inv_record_tree */

    1328             : 
    1329           0 : void adjust_curr_source_line_structure_after_realloc(
    1330             :                                         a_const_char *old_ptr,
    1331             :                                         a_const_char *old_after_end_ptr,
    1332             :                                         a_const_char *new_ptr,
    1333             :                                         a_boolean    adjust_source_line_modifs)
    1334             : /*
    1335             : Walk the data structure associated with curr_source_line, and change any
    1336             : pointers that point in the range old_ptr..old_after_end_ptr (the latter
    1337             : pointer pointing to just after the last byte) to point instead to the
    1338             : area following new_ptr.  This is necessary because the area that was
    1339             : at old_ptr has been realloc'd (to change its size), and new_ptr is the
    1340             : new address for the area.  A caller that needs special processing of source
    1341             : line modifications can pass adjust_source_line_modifs as FALSE; otherwise,
    1342             : the pointers in all source line modifications will be adjusted as needed.
    1343             : */
    1344             : {
    1345           0 :   an_orig_line_modif_ptr       olmp;
    1346           0 :   a_source_line_modif_ptr      slmp;
    1347           0 :   a_macro_arg_ptr              map;
    1348           0 :   a_pointer_registration_ptr   prp;
    1349           0 :   a_const_char                 *old_after_end_plus_1;
    1350             : 
    1351             : /* Macro to adjust a single pointer if it needs it.  Include the address
    1352             :    just past the end of the area moved, since a pointer to there should be
    1353             :    adjusted.  Recall that an extra byte is allocated at the end of each
    1354             :    area so that that address will not be the same as the start address of
    1355             :    the area following it in memory. */
    1356             : #define fix_ptr(ptr)                                                         \
    1357             : { /* Suppress the warning on use of the expired pointer value in CodeCenter. \
    1358             :      Version 3.1.1 warning number. */                                        \
    1359             :   /*SUPPRESS 29*/                                                            \
    1360             :   if (ptr != NULL && ptr_in_range(ptr, old_ptr, old_after_end_plus_1)) {     \
    1361             :     *(a_const_char **)&ptr = ptr - old_ptr + new_ptr;                        \
    1362             :   }  /* if */                                                                \
    1363             : }  /* fix_ptr */
    1364             : 
    1365           0 :   db_enter(4, "adjust_curr_source_line_structure_after_realloc");
    1366             : 
    1367           0 :   check_assertion(old_ptr != NULL);  
    1368             :   /* If the area didn't move, it's not necessary to walk the structure. */
    1369             :   /* Suppress the warning on use of the expired pointer value in CodeCenter.
    1370             :      Version 3.1.1 warning number. */
    1371             :   /*SUPPRESS 29*/
    1372           0 :   if (old_ptr != new_ptr) {
    1373           0 :     old_after_end_plus_1 = old_after_end_ptr + 1;
    1374             :     /* Walk the original line modif list (which represents trigraphs and
    1375             :        line splices).  This is only necessary if it's curr_source_line
    1376             :        that has been relocated, but it doesn't cost much to do it in all
    1377             :        cases. */
    1378           0 :     for (olmp = orig_line_modif_list; olmp != NULL; olmp = olmp->next) {
    1379           0 :       fix_ptr(olmp->line_loc);
    1380             :     }  /* for */
    1381           0 :     if (adjust_source_line_modifs) {
    1382             :       /* Walk the source line modif list (which represents macro expansions
    1383             :          and comment deletions). */
    1384           0 :       for (slmp = source_line_modif_list; slmp != NULL; slmp = slmp->next) {
    1385           0 :         a_concatenation_record_ptr crp;
    1386           0 :         if (slmp->line_loc != NULL &&
    1387           0 :             ptr_in_range(slmp->line_loc, old_ptr, old_after_end_plus_1)) {
    1388           0 :           rem_source_line_modif_from_hash_table(slmp);
    1389           0 :           fix_ptr(slmp->line_loc);
    1390           0 :           add_source_line_modif_to_hash_table(slmp);
    1391             :         }  /* if */
    1392           0 :         fix_ptr(slmp->inserted_text);
    1393           0 :         fix_ptr(slmp->end_inserted_text);
    1394           0 :         for (crp = slmp->concatenations; crp != NULL; crp = crp->next) {
    1395           0 :           fix_ptr(crp->line_loc);
    1396             :         }  /* for */
    1397             :       }  /* for */
    1398             :     }  /* if */
    1399             :     /* Fix pointers in the macro argument entries. */
    1400           0 :     for (map = macro_arg_list; map != NULL; map = map->next) {
    1401           0 :       fix_ptr(map->initial_raw_text_not_in_primary_source_line);
    1402             :     }  /* for */
    1403             :     /* Adjust global variables that point into the curr_source_line
    1404             :        structure. */
    1405           0 :     fix_ptr(curr_char_loc);
    1406           0 :     fix_ptr(delete_source_from_loc);
    1407           0 :     fix_ptr(start_of_curr_token);
    1408           0 :     fix_ptr(end_of_curr_token);
    1409           0 :     fix_ptr(arg_get_token_start_of_curr_token);
    1410             : #if ASM_SUPPORT_NEEDED
    1411           0 :     fix_ptr(prev_asm_stop_char);
    1412             : #endif /* ASM_SUPPORT_NEEDED */
    1413             :     /* Adjust local variables that point into the curr_source_line structure.
    1414             :        Such variables are registered by calling register_pointer_variable. */
    1415           0 :     for (prp = registered_pointers; prp != NULL; prp = prp->next) {
    1416           0 :       char **ptr_ptr = prp->ptr_variable;
    1417           0 :       fix_ptr(*ptr_ptr);
    1418             :     }  /* for */
    1419             : #if MULTIBYTE_CHARS_IN_SOURCE_SUPPORTED
    1420             :     /* If we are reallocating the curr_source_line array, adjust the
    1421             :        logical_char_info array, which contains pointers into
    1422             :        curr_source_line. */
    1423             :     if (old_ptr == curr_source_line) {
    1424             :       int       idx;
    1425             :       for (idx = 0; idx < logical_char_info_entries_used; idx++) {
    1426             :         fix_ptr(logical_char_info[idx]);
    1427             :       }  /* for */
    1428             :     }  /* if */
    1429             : #endif /* MULTIBYTE_CHARS_IN_SOURCE_SUPPORTED */
    1430             :   }  /* if */
    1431           0 :   db_exit();
    1432           0 : }  /* adjust_curr_source_line_structure_after_realloc */
    1433             : 
    1434             : 
    1435           0 : static char* copy_attention_markers(a_source_line_modif_ptr slmp,
    1436             :                                     char                    *next_avail)
    1437             : /*
    1438             : Scan the deleted text of the specified source line modification for
    1439             : ATTENTION_MARKERs and copy them into the buffer designated by next_avail.
    1440             : (The one at slmp->line_loc has already been copied into the destination
    1441             : buffer.)  If a nested ATTENTION_MARKER is found, this routine copies it into
    1442             : the destination buffer and then calls itself recursively for the corresponding
    1443             : source line modification.  Finally, the supplied source line modification's
    1444             : line_loc is relocated to point to the copy and slmp->num_chars_to_delete is
    1445             : adjusted to be the number of ATTENTION_MARKERs copied (directly or indirectly)
    1446             : to the destination buffer, effectively compacting this source line
    1447             : modification's deleted text to the minimum necessary to traverse nested
    1448             : source line modifications (e.g., to detect inert macros).  The return value
    1449             : is the address of the character in the destination buffer immediately
    1450             : following the last copied ATTENTION_MARKER.
    1451             : */
    1452             : {
    1453           0 :   a_const_char *src = slmp->line_loc + 1;
    1454           0 :   char         *this_target = next_avail - 1;
    1455             : 
    1456           0 :   while (src < slmp->line_loc + slmp->num_chars_to_delete) {
    1457           0 :     if (*src == ATTENTION_MARKER) {
    1458           0 :       a_source_line_modif_ptr slmp2 = nested_source_line_modif(src);
    1459           0 :       src += slmp2->num_chars_to_delete;
    1460           0 :       *next_avail++ = ATTENTION_MARKER;
    1461           0 :       next_avail = copy_attention_markers(slmp2, next_avail);
    1462             :     } else {
    1463           0 :       ++src;
    1464             :     }  /* if */
    1465             :   }  /* while */
    1466           0 :   rem_source_line_modif_from_hash_table(slmp);
    1467           0 :   slmp->line_loc = this_target;
    1468           0 :   add_source_line_modif_to_hash_table(slmp);
    1469           0 :   slmp->num_chars_to_delete = next_avail - this_target;
    1470           0 :   return next_avail;
    1471             : }  /* copy_attention_markers */
    1472             : 
    1473             : 
    1474           0 : static void expand_macro_buffer(sizeof_t needed)
    1475             : /*
    1476             : Expand the macro_buffer by reallocating it.  As a side effect, to reduce
    1477             : memory overhead, remove all deleted text (except ATTENTION_MARKERs) while
    1478             : copying from the old buffer to the new one.  Called by
    1479             : ensure_macro_buffer_space.
    1480             : */
    1481             : {
    1482           0 :   sizeof_t                total_needed, old_size, old_len, new_size, increment;
    1483           0 :   char                    *new_macro_buffer;
    1484           0 :   a_const_char            *src;
    1485           0 :   char                    *dst;
    1486           0 :   char                    ch;
    1487           0 :   a_const_char            *old_start_for_remapping;
    1488           0 :   char                    *new_start_for_remapping;
    1489           0 :   a_source_line_modif_ptr slmp;
    1490           0 :   a_source_line_modif_ptr nested_slmp;
    1491           0 :   a_source_line_modif_ptr next_slmp;
    1492           0 :   char                    *old_start_of_uncompacted;
    1493           0 :   sizeof_t                num_chars_to_copy;
    1494             : 
    1495           0 :   db_enter(4, "expand_macro_buffer");
    1496           0 :   old_size = after_end_of_macro_buffer - macro_buffer;
    1497           0 :   old_len = next_avail_in_macro_buffer - macro_buffer;
    1498           0 :   if (needed >= ((sizeof_t)-1) - old_len) {
    1499             :     /* The following calculation of total_needed would overflow, which
    1500             :        could cause use of a too-short buffer and result in overwriting
    1501             :        memory. */
    1502           0 :     catastrophe(ec_requested_size_too_large);
    1503             :   }  /* if */
    1504           0 :   total_needed = old_len + needed;
    1505             :   /* Make sure we ask for enough to satisfy the current request and a
    1506             :      little bit more. */
    1507           0 :   increment = needed + needed/10 -
    1508           0 :               (after_end_of_macro_buffer - next_avail_in_macro_buffer);
    1509           0 :   if (num_chars_deleted_in_macro_buffer > increment &&
    1510           0 :       num_chars_deleted_in_macro_buffer > old_size/4) {
    1511             :     /* Avoid memory growth by using same size buffer -- there's plenty of
    1512             :        room after compaction. */
    1513             :     increment = 0;
    1514           0 :   } else if (increment < old_size) {
    1515             :     /* At least double the current allocation. */
    1516             :     increment = old_size;
    1517             :   }  /* if */
    1518           0 :   new_size = old_size + increment;
    1519           0 :   if (new_size+1 < total_needed && increment != 0) {
    1520             :     /* There is an overflow somewhere in the calculation of the new request
    1521             :        size.  The resulting buffer would be too short and cause overwritten
    1522             :        memory. */
    1523           0 :     catastrophe(ec_requested_size_too_large);
    1524             :   }  /* if */
    1525             :   /* Allocate one more byte than required, so that a pointer past the end
    1526             :      will not have the same address as a pointer to the next object in
    1527             :      memory. */
    1528           0 :   new_macro_buffer = alloc_general((sizeof_t)(new_size+1));
    1529           0 :   if (num_compacted_macro_buffer_chars > 0) {
    1530             :     /* Text that has already been compacted in a previous reallocation can
    1531             :        simply be memcpy'ed and pointers into it adjusted directly, rather
    1532             :        than going through the compaction process again.  This can leave some
    1533             :        uncompacted deletions (when a source line modification is added inside
    1534             :        the already-compacted space as a result of rescanning), but the time
    1535             :        saved makes this a good tradeoff. */
    1536           0 :     (void)memcpy(new_macro_buffer, macro_buffer,
    1537             :                  size_t_arg(num_compacted_macro_buffer_chars));
    1538           0 :     adjust_curr_source_line_structure_after_realloc(macro_buffer,
    1539           0 :                            macro_buffer + num_compacted_macro_buffer_chars - 1,
    1540             :                            new_macro_buffer,
    1541             :                            /*adjust_source_line_modifs=*/FALSE);
    1542             :   }  /* if */
    1543           0 :   old_start_of_uncompacted = macro_buffer + num_compacted_macro_buffer_chars;
    1544           0 :   dst = new_macro_buffer + num_compacted_macro_buffer_chars;
    1545             :   /* Scan through all source line modifications.  For each modification
    1546             :      whose line_loc is in the already-compacted (and already-copied) part of
    1547             :      the buffer, relocate it appropriately; the same for modifications whose
    1548             :      inserted_text is in that region.  Modifications whose inserted text is
    1549             :      in the new (uncompacted) region are copied to the new buffer, scanning
    1550             :      for and compacting deleted text.  The compaction process relocates the
    1551             :      line_loc for the associated source line modification of each deletion,
    1552             :      and adjust_curr_source_line_structure_after_realloc is called for each
    1553             :      block of text copied into the new buffer.  Note also that text in the
    1554             :      macro_buffer whose associated source line modification has been removed
    1555             :      will not be copied, further reducing memory usage. */
    1556           0 :   for (slmp = source_line_modif_list; slmp != NULL; slmp = slmp->next) {
    1557           0 :     a_concatenation_record_ptr crp;
    1558           0 :     if (slmp->line_loc != NULL &&
    1559           0 :         ptr_in_range(slmp->line_loc, macro_buffer, old_start_of_uncompacted)) {
    1560             :       /* slmp->line_loc has already been copied in the compacted portion of
    1561             :          the buffer; just relocate the pointer. */
    1562           0 :       rem_source_line_modif_from_hash_table(slmp);
    1563           0 :       slmp->line_loc = slmp->line_loc - macro_buffer + new_macro_buffer;
    1564           0 :       add_source_line_modif_to_hash_table(slmp);
    1565             :     }  /* if */
    1566           0 :     if (ptr_in_range(slmp->inserted_text, macro_buffer,
    1567             :                      old_start_of_uncompacted)) {
    1568             :       /* The inserted text has already been copied in the compacted portion
    1569             :          of the buffer; just relocate the start and end pointers and all
    1570             :          concatenation records. */
    1571           0 :       slmp->inserted_text =
    1572           0 :                          slmp->inserted_text - macro_buffer + new_macro_buffer;
    1573           0 :       slmp->end_inserted_text =
    1574           0 :                      slmp->end_inserted_text - macro_buffer + new_macro_buffer;
    1575           0 :       for (crp = slmp->concatenations; crp != NULL; crp = crp->next) {
    1576           0 :         crp->line_loc = crp->line_loc - macro_buffer + new_macro_buffer;
    1577             :       }  /* for */
    1578           0 :     } else if (ptr_in_range(slmp->inserted_text, old_start_of_uncompacted,
    1579             :                             next_avail_in_macro_buffer)) {

    1581             :          Scan through it, copying undeleted text and only the
    1582             :          ATTENTION_MARKERs of deleted parts. */
    1583           0 :       src = slmp->inserted_text;
    1584           0 :       slmp->inserted_text = dst;
    1585           0 :       crp = slmp->concatenations;
    1586           0 :       for (;;) {
    1587           0 :         a_boolean is_lexical_escape;
    1588           0 :         old_start_for_remapping = src;
    1589           0 :         new_start_for_remapping = dst;
    1590           0 :         while ((ch = (*dst++ = *src++)) != ATTENTION_MARKER &&
    1591           0 :                ch != LE_END_OF_INSERTION) {}
    1592             :         /* Having copied some number of characters from the old buffer to the

    1604             :         }  /* for */
    1605           0 :         if (ch == ATTENTION_MARKER && !is_lexical_escape) {
    1606             :           /* This is the location of a macro replacement or deleted text.
    1607             :              If it is a macro replacement, copy only the ATTENTION_MARKERs
    1608             :              to the new buffer and adjust the source pointer appropriately.
    1609             :              Deleted text (which occurs when the closing parenthesis of a
    1610             :              macro invocation is not in the source line modification
    1611             :              containing the macro name, a relatively rare situation) can
    1612             :              include character positions that must be relocated, so it must
    1613             :              be copied in full. */
    1614           0 :           sizeof_t orig_deletion_len;
    1615           0 :           nested_slmp = nested_source_line_modif(src - 1);
    1616           0 :           if (nested_slmp->inserted_text == nested_slmp->inserted_chars) {

    1618             :                the location of the deletion and skip over the deleted

    1623             :                details.) */
    1624           0 :             rem_source_line_modif_from_hash_table(nested_slmp);
    1625           0 :             nested_slmp->line_loc = dst - 1;
    1626           0 :             add_source_line_modif_to_hash_table(nested_slmp);

    1632             :             /* This deletion is for a macro replacement: skip over the
    1633             :                replaced characters, copying only any attention markers

    1635           0 :             orig_deletion_len = nested_slmp->num_chars_to_delete;

    1643           0 :                                        slmp->inserted_text));

    1645             :           }  /* if */
    1646           0 :         } else if (ch == LE_END_OF_INSERTION && is_lexical_escape) {
    1647             :           /* This is an end-of-insertion marker (and not just a stray
    1648             :              LE_END_OF_INSERTION character, hence the retroactive check for a
    1649             :              preceding LE_ESCAPE character -- there will typically be lots of
    1650             :              LE_ESCAPEs that are not end-of-insertions (because of token-ends),
    1651             :              so it's much faster to scan for LE_END_OF_INSERTION in the
    1652             :              character-copying loop and then check for the preceding
    1653             :              character). */
    1654           0 :           check_assertion(slmp->end_inserted_text == src - LE_ESCAPE_LEN);
