    1656           0 :           check_assertion(crp == NULL);
    1657             :           break;
    1658             :         }  /* if */
    1659             :       }  /* for */
    1660             :     }  /* if */
    1661             :   }  /* for */
    1662           0 :   num_compacted_macro_buffer_chars = dst - new_macro_buffer;
    1663           0 :   if (macro_buffer_region_in_progress != NULL) {
    1664             :     /* The end of the old buffer contains data that is not referred to by a
    1665             :        source line modification and thus must be copied specially into the
    1666             :        new buffer. */
    1667           0 :     check_assertion(ptr_in_range(macro_buffer_region_in_progress, macro_buffer,
    1668             :                                  next_avail_in_macro_buffer + 1));
    1669           0 :     num_chars_to_copy =
    1670           0 :                   next_avail_in_macro_buffer - macro_buffer_region_in_progress;
    1671           0 :     (void)memcpy(dst, macro_buffer_region_in_progress,
    1672             :                  size_t_arg(num_chars_to_copy));
    1673           0 :     adjust_curr_source_line_structure_after_realloc(
    1674             :                                           macro_buffer_region_in_progress,
    1675             :                                           next_avail_in_macro_buffer, dst,
    1676             :                                           /*adjust_source_line_modifs=*/FALSE);
    1677           0 :     macro_buffer_region_in_progress = dst;
    1678           0 :     dst += num_chars_to_copy;
    1679             :   }  /* if */
    1680             :   /* Check to see if any of the source line modifications are replacements
    1681             :      for text in the old buffer that was not copied into the new buffer; if
    1682             :      so, break that association or remove the modification, as appropriate.
    1683             :      One way this occurs is when read_logical_source_line is called during
    1684             :      a macro invocation.  In that case, all source line modifications
    1685             :      except those holding saved text for scanned macro arguments are
    1686             :      removed, and the line_loc for those modifications can refer to text
    1687             :      associated with modifications that were removed.  Another case is when
    1688             :      expand_top_level_pcc_macro is in the process of replacing the
    1689             :      top-level expansion and the text being replaced has leftover deletions
    1690             :      from LE_RAW_OR_EXPANDED_ARGUMENT sequences. */
    1691           0 :   for (slmp = source_line_modif_list; slmp != NULL; slmp = next_slmp) {
    1692           0 :     next_slmp = slmp->next;

    1694             :                      next_avail_in_macro_buffer)) {
    1695           0 :       check_assertion(slmp->contains_saved_macro_argument_text ||

    1697             :                                    discarded_pcc_top_level_begin,
    1698             :                                    discarded_pcc_top_level_end));
    1699           0 :       if (slmp->contains_saved_macro_argument_text) {
    1700             :         /* Break the modification's association with the buffer text. */
    1701           0 :         rem_source_line_modif_from_hash_table(slmp);
    1702           0 :         slmp->line_loc = NULL;
    1703           0 :         slmp->num_chars_to_delete = 0;
    1704             :       } else {
    1705             :         /* Remove the leftover raw/expanded text deletion. */
    1706           0 :         a_source_line_modif_ptr slmp2 = slmp;
    1707           0 :         rem_source_line_modif(slmp2);
    1708           0 :         free_source_line_modif(&slmp2);
    1709             :       }  /* if */
    1710             :     }  /* if */
    1711             :   }  /* for */
    1712           0 :   free_general((a_void_ptr)macro_buffer, (sizeof_t)(old_size+1));
    1713           0 :   macro_buffer = new_macro_buffer;
    1714           0 :   after_end_of_macro_buffer = macro_buffer + new_size;
    1715           0 :   next_avail_in_macro_buffer = dst;
    1716           0 :   num_chars_deleted_in_macro_buffer = 0;
    1717           0 :   check_assertion((sizeof_t)(after_end_of_macro_buffer -
    1718             :                              next_avail_in_macro_buffer) > needed);
    1719           0 :   db_exit();
    1720           0 : }  /* expand_macro_buffer */
    1721             : 
    1722             : 
    1723             : /*
    1724             : Ensure that at least "needed" bytes of space remain in macro_buffer.
    1725             : If not, expand macro_buffer by reallocating it.
    1726             : */
    1727             : #define ensure_macro_buffer_space(needed)                             \
    1728             : { sizeof_t temp_needed = (needed);                                    \
    1729             :   if (temp_needed > (sizeof_t)(after_end_of_macro_buffer -            \
    1730             :                                next_avail_in_macro_buffer)) {         \
    1731             :     expand_macro_buffer(temp_needed);                                 \
    1732             :   }  /* if */                                                         \
    1733             : }  /* ensure_macro_buffer_space */
    1734             : 
    1735             : 
    1736      241881 : static char* begin_macro_buffer_region(void)
    1737             : /*
    1738             : Mark the existence and beginning location of a region at the tail of the
    1739             : macro_buffer that must be copied specially upon macro_buffer reallocation.
    1740             : This routine must be called whenever a data structure will be built in the
    1741             : macro_buffer incrementally, i.e., with the possibility of a reallocation
    1742             : occurring before the structure is complete.  For convenience, it returns
    1743             : next_avail_in_macro_buffer, where the structure being built will begin.
    1744             : */
    1745             : {
    1746      241881 :   check_assertion(macro_buffer_region_in_progress == NULL);
    1747      241881 :   macro_buffer_region_in_progress = next_avail_in_macro_buffer;
    1748      241881 :   return next_avail_in_macro_buffer;
    1749             : }  /* begin_macro_buffer_region */
    1750             : 
    1751             : 
    1752      241881 : static void release_macro_buffer_region(void)

    1760      241881 :   macro_buffer_region_in_progress = NULL;

    1763             : 
    1764           0 : static void expand_aux_buffer_for_pcc_macros(sizeof_t needed,
    1765             :                                              char     *pos_in_aux_buffer)
    1766             : /*
    1767             : Expand aux_buffer_for_pcc_macros by reallocating it.  Called by
    1768             : ensure_aux_buffer_for_pcc_macros_space.  pos_in_aux_buffer points to
    1769             : the pointer to the next available position in that buffer.
    1770             : */
    1771             : {
    1772           0 :   sizeof_t total_needed, old_size, old_len, new_size, increment;
    1773           0 :   char     *new_aux_buffer_for_pcc_macros;
    1774             : 
    1775           0 :   db_enter(4, "expand_aux_buffer_for_pcc_macros");

    1777             :              aux_buffer_for_pcc_macros;

    1780             :     /* The following calculation of total_needed would overflow, which
    1781             :        could cause use of a too-short buffer and result in overwriting
    1782             :        memory. */
    1783           0 :     catastrophe(ec_requested_size_too_large);
    1784             :   }  /* if */

    1786             :   /* Not enough space; need to expand.  Make sure we ask for enough
    1787             :      to satisfy the current request and a little bit more. */

    1791             :     /* At least double the current allocation. */
    1792             :     increment = old_size;

    1796             :     /* There is an overflow somewhere in the calculation of the new request
    1797             :        size.  The resulting buffer would be too short and cause overwritten

    1799           0 :     catastrophe(ec_requested_size_too_large);

    1802             :      will not have the same address as a pointer to the next object in

    2138      314956 : static void free_macro_arg(a_macro_arg_ptr *map)
    2139             : /*
    2140             : Free the macro argument description pointed to by *map, and set *map to NULL.
    2141             : */
    2142             : {
    2143      314956 :   db_enter(5, "free_macro_arg");
    2144             :   /* Put the macro buffer on a list of macro buffers freed and available
    2145             :      to be reused. */
    2146      314956 :   (*map)->next = avail_macro_args;
    2147      314956 :   avail_macro_args = *map;
    2148      314956 :   *map = NULL;
    2149      314956 :   db_exit();
    2150      314956 : }  /* free_macro_arg */
    2151             : 
    2152             : 
    2153             : #if DEBUG
    2154           0 : static void print_markered_text(a_const_char *str,

    2311      205368 : static void check_for_following_parenthesis(a_boolean    *paren_found,
    2312             :                                             a_boolean    allow_id)
    2313             : /*
    2314             : The current token is an identifier, probably the macro name at the
    2315             : beginning of a macro invocation.  Skip white space and look to see if the
    2316             : next token is a "(", and return *paren_found == TRUE if it is.  If allow_id
    2317             : is TRUE, also return *paren_found == TRUE if the next token is an identifier.
    2318             : If a "(" (or identifier) is not found, return *paren_found == FALSE and
    2319             : re-insert the identifier if necessary (delete_source_from_loc is non-NULL,
    2320             : so a hanging delete is in effect).
    2321             : */

    2444             : 
    2445       88803 : static a_token_kind scan_defined_operator(void)
    2446             : /*
    2447             : Scan an instance of the "defined" operator in a preprocessor expression.
    2448             : It has the form
    2449             : 
    2450             :   defined identifier
    2451             : 
    2452             : or
    2453             : 
    2454             :   defined ( identifier )
    2455             : 
    2456             : (See standard, 3.8.1).  If the "defined" identifier is not an operator
    2457             : in this case, return tok_identifier.  Otherwise (including in error
    2458             : cases), set const_for_curr_token to a value of 0L (not defined) or 1L
    2459             : (defined), and return tok_int_constant.  On return, the first token
    2460             : beyond the operator has not yet been fetched.
    2461             : */
    2462             : {
    2463       88803 :   a_symbol_ptr  assoc_symbol = NULL;
    2464       88803 :   a_symbol_header_ptr
    2465       88803 :                 sym_hdr = NULL;

    2467             :                 start_position;

    2469       88803 :   a_boolean     save_expand_macros = expand_macros;
    2470       88803 :   a_boolean     paren_or_id_found;
    2471       88803 :   a_boolean     in_macro_expansion =
    2472             :                                  !within_curr_source_line(start_of_curr_token);
    2473       88803 :   a_boolean     parenthesized_form;

    2478             :     /* If not inside a #if expression, "defined" is just an identifier. */
    2479             :     ctoken = tok_identifier;

    2560       88803 :         if (assoc_symbol != NULL) {

    2564             :             !paren_followed_by_whitespace) {

    2566             :              parenthesized form of "defined" unconditionally having the
    2567             :              value 0 if it appears in a macro expansion and the left
    2568             :              parenthesis is not followed by white space; some system
    2569             :              headers depend on this behavior.  (The unparenthesized form is
    2570             :              processed correctly, as is the parenthesized form when the
    2571             :              operand is separated from the left parenthesis by a space or
    2572             :              comment.) */
    2573             :           pos_warning(ec_defined_always_false, &start_position);
    2574             :           assoc_symbol = NULL;
    2575             :         }  /* if */
    2576             :       }  /* if */
    2577       88803 :       ctoken = make_pp_int_constant((long)(assoc_symbol != NULL));
    2578             :       /* Set the token position to the start of the keyword "defined". */
    2579       88803 :       copy_source_position(start_position, pos_curr_token);
    2580             :     }  /* if */
    2581             :   }  /* if */
    2582       88803 :   expand_macros = save_expand_macros;
    2583       88803 :   db_exit();
    2584       88803 :   return (ctoken);
    2585             : }  /* scan_defined_operator */
    2586             : 
    2587             : 
    2588           0 : static a_macro_arg_ptr copy_pragma_string(void)
    2589             : /*

    2591             : Make a copy of the string to a macro argument, replacing \" with " and \\

    2602             :   /* Compute the length of the string.  Note that this will include the

    2676           0 : static void scan_pragma_string(

    2680             : /*

    2739           0 : static void scan_pragma_operator(
    2740             :                 a_boolean                       *got_proper_closing_token,
    2741             :                 a_pragma_kind_description_ptr   *pragma_descr)
    2742             : /*
    2743             : Process a C99-style _Pragma operator.  The current token is the _Pragma
    2744             : identifier token.  The form of a _Pragma invocation is:
    2745             : 
    2746             :         _Pragma("string")
    2747             : 
    2748             : The first component of "string" is the pragma identifier, which may be followed
    2749             : by pragma arguments.
    2750             : 
    2751             : If the pragma operator is badly formed and we don't successfully find its
    2752             : end, got_proper_closing_token is set to FALSE, otherwise it is unchanged.
    2753             : Information about the pragma that was found is returned in *pragma_descr.
    2754             : Note that the value returned through *pragma_descr can be NULL.
    2755             : */
    2756             : {
    2757           0 :   a_boolean             save_fetch_pp_tokens = fetch_pp_tokens;
    2758           0 :   a_boolean             save_expand_macros = expand_macros;
    2759           0 :   a_source_position     start_of_dir_position;
    2760           0 :   a_boolean             found_end_of_operator = FALSE;
    2761           0 :   a_boolean             err = FALSE;
    2762             : 
    2763             :   /* The inside of the _Pragma directive should be processed as pp-tokens. */
    2764           0 :   fetch_pp_tokens = TRUE;
    2765             :   /* Record the position of the start of the pragma. */
    2766           0 :   start_of_dir_position = pos_curr_token;
    2767             :   /* Bypass the _Pragma token. */
    2768           0 :   (void)get_token();
    2769           0 :   *pragma_descr = NULL;
    2770           0 :   if (curr_token != tok_lparen) {
    2771           0 :     pos_error(ec_exp_lparen, &error_position);
    2772           0 :     err = TRUE;
    2773           0 :   } else if (get_token() != tok_string_literal) {
    2774           0 :     pos_error(ec_exp_string_literal, &error_position);
    2775           0 :     err = TRUE;
    2776             :   } else {
    2777           0 :     a_macro_arg_ptr     map;
    2778             :     /* We've scanned a string literal.  Make a copy of the string
    2779             :        literal replacing \" with " and \\ with \. */
    2780           0 :     map = copy_pragma_string();
    2781             :     /* Scan the tokens from the pragma string.  Don't expand macros inside the
    2782             :        string. */
    2783           0 :     expand_macros = FALSE;
    2784           0 :     scan_pragma_string(map, &start_of_dir_position, pragma_descr);
    2785           0 :     free_macro_arg(&map);
    2786             :   }  /* if */
    2787             :   /* Restore the previous state for expanding macros so that the closing
    2788             :      parenthesis can be supplied by a macro. */
    2789           0 :   expand_macros = save_expand_macros;
    2790           0 :   if (!err) {
    2791             :     /* Bypass the scanned string and check for the closing parenthesis. */
    2792           0 :     (void)get_token();

    2794             :       found_end_of_operator = TRUE;
    2795             :     } else {
    2796           0 :       pos_error(ec_exp_rparen, &error_position);
    2797           0 :       curr_char_loc = start_of_curr_token;
    2798             :     }  /* if */
    2799             :   }  /* if */
    2800             :   /* Restore the previous state for fetching pp-tokens. */
    2801           0 :   fetch_pp_tokens = save_fetch_pp_tokens;
    2802             :   /* If we didn't find the end of the operator, clear the flag passed
    2803             :      by the caller. */
    2804           0 :   if (!found_end_of_operator) {
    2805           0 :     *got_proper_closing_token = FALSE;
    2806             :     /* The main purpose of the following is to insure that we don't return
    2807             :        a tok_identifier when we might have an invalid locator (e.g., the
    2808             :        symbol header could be unset). */

    2810             :   }  /* if */

    2841             : 
    2842           0 : static void scan_microsoft_pragma_operator(
    2843             :                 a_boolean                       *got_proper_closing_token,
    2844             :                 a_pragma_kind_description_ptr   *pragma_descr)
    2845             : /*
    2846             : Process a Microsoft __pragma operator.  The current token is the
    2847             : __pragma identifier token.  The form of a __pragma invocation is:
    2848             : 
    2849             :         __pragma(tokens)
    2850             : 
    2851             : The first component of "tokens" is the pragma identifier, which may be
    2852             : followed by pragma arguments.
    2853             : 
    2854             : If the pragma operator is badly formed and we don't successfully find its
    2855             : end, got_proper_closing_token is set to FALSE, otherwise it is unchanged.
    2856             : Information about the pragma that was found is returned in *pragma_descr.
    2857             : Note that the value returned through *pragma_descr can be NULL.
    2858             : */
    2859             : {
    2860           0 :   a_boolean             save_fetch_pp_tokens = fetch_pp_tokens;
    2861           0 :   a_boolean             save_expand_macros = expand_macros;
    2862           0 :   a_source_position     start_of_dir_position;
    2863           0 :   a_boolean             found_end_of_operator = FALSE;
    2864             : 
    2865             :   /* The inside of the _pragma directive should be processed as pp-tokens. */
    2866           0 :   fetch_pp_tokens = TRUE;
    2867           0 :   expand_macros = FALSE;
    2868           0 :   *pragma_descr = NULL;
    2869             :   /* Record the position of the start of the pragma. */
    2870           0 :   start_of_dir_position = pos_curr_token;
    2871             :   /* Bypass the __pragma token. */
    2872           0 :   (void)get_token();
    2873           0 :   if (curr_token != tok_lparen) {
    2874           0 :     pos_error(ec_exp_lparen, &error_position);
    2875             :   } else {
    2876             :     /* Scan the tokens of the pragma and create the pragma entry. */
    2877           0 :     process_microsoft_pragma_operator(&start_of_dir_position, pragma_descr);
    2878             :     /* Check for the closing parenthesis. */
    2879           0 :     if (curr_token == tok_rparen) {
    2880             :       found_end_of_operator = TRUE;
    2881             :     } else {
    2882           0 :       pos_error(ec_exp_rparen, &error_position);
    2883           0 :       curr_char_loc = start_of_curr_token;
    2884             :     }  /* if */
    2885             :   }  /* if */
    2886             :   /* Restore the previous state for fetching pp-tokens, and expanding
    2887             :      macros. */
    2888           0 :   fetch_pp_tokens = save_fetch_pp_tokens;
    2889           0 :   expand_macros = save_expand_macros;
    2890             :   /* If we didn't find the end of the operator, clear the flag passed
    2891             :      by the caller. */
    2892           0 :   if (!found_end_of_operator) {

    2897           0 :     if (curr_token != tok_end_of_source) curr_token = tok_error;
    2898             :   }  /* if */
    2899             :   /* If the pragma was an immediate pragma, process it now. */
    2900           0 :   process_immediate_pragmas();

    2902             : 
    2903             : 
    2904             : /*
    2905             : Skip white space and set a flag indicating whether or not any was
    2906             : skipped.  Used within macro invocations.  Under pcc compatibility mode,
    2907             : comment-only white space is ignored.
    2908             : */
    2909             : #define macro_skip_white_space(any_skipped) \
    2910             : { skip_white_space(); \
    2911             :   any_skipped = FALSE; \
    2912             :   if (kind_of_white_space_skipped != 0) { \
    2913             :     if (kind_of_white_space_skipped != WHITE_SPACE_COMMENTS || \
    2914             :         !pcc_preprocessing_mode) { \
    2915             :       any_skipped = TRUE; \
    2916             :     }  /* if */ \
    2917             :   }  /* if */ \
    2918             : }  /* macro_skip_white_space */
    2919             : 
    2920             : 
    2921           0 : void choose_raw_or_expanded_arg(void)
    2922             : /*
    2923             : curr_char_loc points to an LE_RAW_OR_EXPANDED_ARGUMENT lexical escape.
    2924             : Immediately following is the ATTENTION_MARKER of a deletion source line
    2925             : modification whose deleted text is the raw version of a macro argument.
    2926             : Immediately following the deleted text is an ATTENTION_MARKER of a deletion
    2927             : source line modification whose deleted text is the expanded version of the
    2928             : macro argument.  Depending on the value of use_raw_version_of_arg, remove
    2929             : one or the other of those source line modifications and change the
    2930             : LE_RAW_OR_EXPANDED_ARGUMENT lexical escape to an LE_END_OF_TOKEN so this
    2931             : routine will not be invoked twice for the same argument.
    2932             : 
    2933             : This is used to support the following Microsoft idiosyncrasy.  Given the
    2934             : macro definitions
    2935             : 
    2936             :     #define M1(x) M2(##x)
    2937             :     #define M3 xyz
    2938             : 
    2939             : and an invocation
    2940             : 
    2941             :     M1(M3)
    2942             : 
    2943             : whether the argument to M1 is expanded to xyz or left as M3 depends on the
    2944             : characteristics of M2.  If M2 is a macro that uses its argument as an
    2945             : operand of a paste (##) operator, the raw version of M3 is used; otherwise,
    2946             : the expanded version is used.  For example, with
    2947             : 
    2948             :     #define M2(x) abc ## x
    2949             : 
    2950             : the result will be abcM3, while with
    2951             : 
    2952             :     #define M2(x) abc x
    2953             : 
    2954             : the result will be abc xyz.  To support deferring the determination of
    2955             : whether to use the raw or expanded version of the argument until its
    2956             : eventual use is known, both versions are copied into the expanded text with
    2957             : their text deleted, the modifications are marked with the
    2958             : is_raw_or_expanded_arg flag (to prevent the deletions from being compacted
    2959             : if the macro buffer is expanded), and the construct preceded by an
    2960             : LE_RAW_OR_EXPANDED_ARGUMENT lexical escape.  When macro_invocation is about
    2961             : to read the first token of a macro argument, it sets use_raw_version_of_arg
    2962             : according to whether the corresponding parameter is used in a paste
    2963             : operation, and skip_white_space calls this routine whenever it encounters
    2964             : an LE_RAW_OR_EXPANDED_ARGUMENT lexical escape.
    2965             : */
    2966             : {
    2967           0 :   a_const_char *raw_loc = curr_char_loc + LE_ESCAPE_LEN;
    2968           0 :   a_source_line_modif_ptr raw_slmp = nested_source_line_modif(raw_loc);
    2969           0 :   a_source_line_modif_ptr exp_slmp =
    2970           0 :              nested_source_line_modif(raw_loc + raw_slmp->num_chars_to_delete);
    2971             : 
    2972           0 :   if (use_raw_version_of_arg) {
    2973             :     /* Remove the deletion source line modification from the raw version of
    2974             :        the argument, leaving the expanded one deleted, and update the
    2975             :        deletion count in macro_buffer accordingly. */
    2976           0 :     rem_source_line_modif(raw_slmp);
    2977           0 :     free_source_line_modif(&raw_slmp);
    2978             :     /* Mark the expanded version as an ordinary deletion. */
    2979           0 :     exp_slmp->is_raw_or_expanded_arg = FALSE;
    2980           0 :     adjust_deletion_counts(exp_slmp->line_loc, exp_slmp->num_chars_to_delete);
    2981             :   } else {
    2982             :     /* Remove the deletion source line modification from the expanded
    2983             :        version of the argument, leaving the raw one deleted, and update the
    2984             :        delete count in macro_buffer accordingly. */
    2985           0 :     rem_source_line_modif(exp_slmp);
    2986           0 :     free_source_line_modif(&exp_slmp);
    2987             :     /* Mark the raw version as an ordinary deletion. */
    2988           0 :     raw_slmp->is_raw_or_expanded_arg = FALSE;
    2989           0 :     adjust_deletion_counts(raw_slmp->line_loc, raw_slmp->num_chars_to_delete);
    2990             :   }  /* if */
    2991             :   /* Ensure that this routine is not called again for this argument. */
    2992           0 :   *(char *)(curr_char_loc + 1) = LE_END_OF_TOKEN;
    2993           0 : }  /* choose_raw_or_expanded_arg */
    2994             : 
    2995             : 
    2996     1708730 : static a_token_kind arg_get_token(a_boolean     *any_white_space_skipped)
    2997             : /*
    2998             : Fetch and return a token as part of scanning a macro argument.  Return
    2999             : *any_white_space_skipped == TRUE if any white space was skipped (the white
    3000             : space will also be deleted).  The global variable
    3001             : arg_get_token_start_of_curr_token is set to the character position after
    3002             : the white-space skip, which differs from start_of_curr_token when the token
    3003             : is preceded by an inert-macro escape.  The global variable
    3004             : empty_variadic_macro_seen will be TRUE after the call if and only if the
    3005             : call to skip_white_space encountered an LE_EMPTY_VARIADIC_MACRO marker.
    3006             : The global variable comma_is_from_argument will be TRUE after the call if
    3007             : and only if the call to skip_white_space encountered an
    3008             : LE_COMMA_FROM_ARGUMENT marker.  The global variable comma_is_magic will be
    3009             : TRUE after the call if and only if the call to skip_white_space encountered
    3010             : an LE_MICROSOFT_MAGIC_COMMA followed by a comma.  In that case, whether the
    3011             : comma is skipped or included depends on the context.  If the comma appears
    3012             : directly in the argument to a macro that takes exactly one parameter, it is
    3013             : included; in all other cases, it is skipped.
    3014             : */
    3015             : {
    3016     1708730 :   a_token_kind tok = tok_error;
    3017     1708730 :   a_boolean    skip_comma;
    3018             : 
    3019     1708730 :   do {
    3020     1708730 :     comma_is_from_argument = FALSE;
    3021     1708730 :     comma_is_magic = FALSE;
    3022     1708730 :     empty_variadic_macro_seen = FALSE;
    3023     1708730 :     macro_skip_white_space(*any_white_space_skipped);
    3024     1708730 :     arg_get_token_start_of_curr_token = curr_char_loc;
    3025     1708730 :     if (comma_is_magic && !within_curr_source_line(curr_char_loc)) {
    3026             :       /* The skip traversed an LE_MICROSOFT_MAGIC_COMMA lexical escape, so
    3027             :          curr_char_loc now points to a comma that preceded an empty
    3028             :          __VA_ARGS__ expansion.  Such commas are suppressed unless they
    3029             :          appear directly in a macro argument list and that macro has
    3030             :          exactly one parameter.  Check to see if the comma at curr_char_loc
    3031             :          is embedded in the expansion of one of this macro's arguments,
    3032             :          i.e., if its source modification is newer than the one containing
    3033             :          the name of the macro.  If so, or if the macro whose arguments are
    3034             :          being fetched has more than one parameter, it's an ordinary magic
    3035             :          comma that needs to be skipped; otherwise, it should not be
    3036             :          suppressed. */
    3037           0 :       a_source_line_modif_ptr slmp = assoc_source_line_modif(curr_char_loc);
    3038           0 :       skip_comma = (slmp->sequence_id > macro_name_modif_seq ||
    3039           0 :                     !single_param_macro);
    3040             :     } else {
    3041             :       skip_comma = FALSE;
    3042             :     }  /* if */
    3043             :     if (skip_comma) {
    3044             :       /* Step over the comma and loop again to skip any following white
    3045             :          space. */
    3046           0 :       ++curr_char_loc;
    3047             :     } else {
    3048             :       /* Get the next token and exit the loop. */
    3049     1708730 :       tok = get_token();

    3051     1708730 :   } while (skip_comma);
    3052     1708730 :   return tok;

    3055             : 
    3056      935762 : static sizeof_t length_for_curr_token_save(a_boolean need_end_of_token_marker,
    3057             :                                            a_boolean any_white_space_skipped)
    3058             : /*

    3066             :

    3074      935762 : static void add_curr_token_text_to_buffer(a_boolean need_end_of_token_marker,
    3075             :                                           a_boolean any_white_space_skipped,
    3076             :                                           char      *buffer)
    3077             : /*
    3078             : Add a textual version of the current token to the indicated buffer.
    3079             : If need_end_of_token_marker is TRUE, put an end-of-token marker escape
    3080             : out first.  If any_white_space_skipped is TRUE, a blank is put out
    3081             : before the token (and after the end-of-token marker, if any).

    3083             : */

    3085      935762 :   if (need_end_of_token_marker) {

    3115             : 
    3116             : static sizeof_t stringized_arg(a_macro_arg_ptr map,
    3117             :                                char            **src_loc,
    3118             :                                a_boolean       charize)
    3119             : /*
    3120             : Generate the "stringized" version of the macro argument indicated by map,
    3121             : store it into the current source line at *src_loc, and increment
    3122             : *src_loc appropriately.  See standard, 3.8.3.2.  The "#" operator produces
    3123             : the stringized version of an argument.  Return the length of the
    3124             : stringized version.  If src_loc is NULL, the output is not stored, so
    3125             : the overall function of this routine is just to compute and return the
    3126             : length of the stringized version.
    3127             : This function also supports a Microsoft extension that makes the "#@" operator
    3128             : produce a "charized" version of the argument (i.e., a character literal).
    3129             : In such cases, charize is TRUE.
    3130             : */
    3131             : {
    3132             :   sizeof_t   len = 0;
    3133             :   char       *p;
    3134             :   char       ch;
    3135             :   a_boolean  within_char_literal = FALSE;
    3136             :   a_boolean  start_of_token = TRUE;
    3137             :   char       quote_char = (charize ? '\'' : '"');
    3138             : 
    3139             :   /* Put out initial quote. */
    3140             :   len++;
    3141             :   if (src_loc != NULL) *(*src_loc)++ = quote_char;
    3142             :   /* Scan through the raw text of the argument, stopping at the end.
    3143             :      Delete end of token markers.  Keep track of when we are inside of
    3144             :      a character constant or string literal, and put out a "\" in front
    3145             :      of each " or \ within those. */

    3155             :            string literal, and start of another token soon.  The end of

    3159             :         start_of_token = TRUE;

    3162             :         /* End of argument. */
    3163             :         break;

    3165             :         /* A null is passed through as \000 if inside a string.  Otherwise,

    3175             :         }  /* if */
    3176             :         p += LE_ESCAPE_LEN-1;
    3177             : #if !FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS
    3178             :       /* Note: LE_END_OF_TOP_LEVEL_EXPANSION should never occur in a macro

    3180             :          the following unexpected condition clause. */
    3181             : #endif /* !FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS */
    3182             :       } else {
    3183             :         unexpected_condition_str("stringized_arg: bad lexical escape");
    3184             :       }  /* if */
    3185             :     } else {
    3186             :       /* If the current character is a " or ' at the start of a token,
    3187             :          then this token is a character constant or string literal. */
    3188             :       if (start_of_token &&
    3189             :           (ch == '"' || ch == '\'' ||
    3190             :            ((ch == 'u' || ch == 'U' || ch == 'L' || ch == 'R') &&
    3191             :             scan_encoding_prefix(p) != SCLK_NOT_A_LITERAL))) {
    3192             :         /* Start of character constant or string literal. */
    3193             :         within_char_literal = TRUE;

    3196             :          a token.  Note that all white space has already been standardized
    3197             :          to a single blank so that is all we have to check for. */

    3213             :            following a right parenthesis to allow token concatenation
    3214             :            between the last fragment of a macro expansion and the
    3215             :            immediately-following text.  As a result we need special
    3216             :            handling to recognize that anything following a right
    3217             :            parenthesis is the start of a new token; otherwise, we will
    3218             :            fail to escape the quotes in a literal that immediately follows

    3230             : 
    3231             : 
    3232           0 : static void expand_top_level_pcc_macro(a_source_line_modif_ptr main_slmp)
    3233             : /*
    3234             : We are in pcc mode, and a top-level macro has just been expanded.  main_slmp
    3235             : points to the source modification that inserts the body of the macro
    3236             : into the primary source line.  In order to more closely approximate the
    3237             : token-pasting behavior of pcc, macro-expand the text in the body of
    3238             : the macro, then make a copy of the macro-expanded version as one long
    3239             : string.  If some of the rest of the primary source line looks like
    3240             : it could be token-pasted with the last token in the macro expansion, add
    3241             : it to the end of the macro expansion (and effectively remove it from the
    3242             : primary source line).  Note that after the first call of this routine
    3243             : that pastes on the end of the line, any subsequent calls of this routine
    3244             : for that line will see the tacked-on text rather than the primary source
    3245             : line (e.g., main_slmp will be a modification of that text).  Also used
    3246             : in Microsoft mode; in that case, token pasting off the end is not allowed.
    3247             : */
    3248             : {
    3249           0 :   a_boolean     save_fetch_pp_tokens = fetch_pp_tokens;
    3250           0 :   a_boolean     save_treat_newline_as_token = treat_newline_as_token;
    3251           0 :   a_boolean     any_white_space_skipped = FALSE;
    3252           0 :   unsigned long sequence_id;
    3253           0 :   a_source_line_modif_ptr
    3254             :                 slmp,

    3659             : 
    3660             : /*

    3663             : are linked together, so the later ones can be found, albeit slowly.

    3675             : that's an easy look-up in arg_values.  After that, a linear search is needed.
    3676             : */

    3678             : { if (number <= ARG_VALUES_SIZE) {                                    \

    3722             : static a_boolean is_microsoft_function_name_paste(a_macro_arg_ptr map,
    3723             :                                                   a_const_char    *prev_text,
    3724             :                                                   sizeof_t        prev_len,
    3725             :                                                   a_const_char    **post_end)
    3726             : /*
    3727             : We are in Microsoft mode and we are doing a token paste in a macro
    3728             : expansion.  Return TRUE if the paste operation is pasting "L" to one
    3729             : of the Microsoft function-name keywords like __FUNCTION__.  
    3730             : The raw value of the macro argument map is the text following
    3731             : the "##", and prev_text (of length prev_len) is the text preceding
    3732             : the ##.  If TRUE is returned, *post_end is set to the character
    3733             : position after the end of the function-name keyword.
    3734             : */
    3735             : {
    3736             :   a_boolean result = FALSE;
    3737             :

    3742             :     if (prev_len == 1 ||

    3746             :       /* The preceding text ends with a token that is "L". */
    3747             :       if (map->raw_len >= 3 &&

    3778             : 
    3779       45930 : static char *find_final_inert_escape(char     *text_loc,
    3780             :                                      sizeof_t sect_len)
    3781             : /*
    3782             : text_loc points to a string of replacement text for an rt_raw_argument
    3783             : insertion, of length sect_len.  If there is an inert-macro escape at the
    3784             : end of the string (followed by an identifier, but no other escapes), return
    3785             : a pointer to it.  Otherwise, return NULL.  (Note that this processing does
    3786             : not apply to temporarily-inert macro escapes, which will be removed in the
    3787             : expansion of the top-level macro invocation.)
    3788             : */
    3789             : {
    3790       45930 :   char     *final_inert_escape = NULL;
    3791       45930 :   sizeof_t len;
    3792             : 
    3793      275660 :   for (len = sect_len; len > 0; len--) {
    3794      229730 :     if (text_loc[len-1] == LE_ESCAPE) {
    3795           0 :       if (text_loc[len] == LE_INERT_MACRO) {
    3796             :         final_inert_escape = text_loc+len-1;
    3797             :         break;
    3798           0 :       } else if (text_loc[len] == LE_END_OF_TOKEN) {

    3800             :         break;
    3801             :       }  /* if */
    3802             :     }  /* if */
    3803             :   }  /* for */
    3804       45930 :   return final_inert_escape;

    3807             : 
    3808           0 : static void adjust_length_for_magic_arg(a_repl_text_seq_kind kind,
    3809             :                                         char                 *rtp,
    3810             :                                         sizeof_t             n_params,
    3811             :                                         a_macro_arg_ptr      *arg_values,
    3812             :                                         sizeof_t             *length,
    3813             :                                         a_boolean            *add_escape)
    3814             : /*
    3815             : Check if the operator to which rtp points (an rt_paste or
    3816             : rt_microsoft_magic_arg_marker) is followed by an empty substitution of the
    3817             : variadic macro parameter.  If so, and if it is immediately preceded by a
    3818             : comma (optionally followed by white space), the comma is generally removed
    3819             : (along with any white space).  (The removal does not occur in Microsoft
    3820             : mode when the comma appears inside a macro argument list.)  This strange
    3821             : behavior is emulated for Microsoft variadic macros and when extended
    3822             : variadic macros are enabled.  Some preprocessors (notably from the GNU
    3823             : project) implement this to work around the following problem:
    3824             : 
    3825             :         #define M(fmt, args) printf(fmt , ## args)
    3826             :         void f() { M("Hello.\n"); }
    3827             : 
    3828             : Without the "deletion effect", the macro would generate an extraneous
    3829             : comma.  (The Microsoft variety of variadic macros does this even without
    3830             : the "##" operator.)  kind describes what kind of section preceded the
    3831             : operator.  rtp points to the replacement text sections starting at the
    3832             : rt_paste or rt_microsoft_magic_arg_marker.  n_params is the number of
    3833             : parameters in the macro.  arg_values is a pointer to an array of
    3834             : a_macro_arg_ptr elements: it is referred to by the get_arg_value macro and
    3835             : hence its name should not be changed.  *length is the value to be adjusted.
    3836             : In non-Microsoft mode, *length is set to exclude the comma.  In Microsoft
    3837             : mode, we don't know yet whether the comma will appear in a macro argument
    3838             : list or not, so *length is set so that an LE_MICROSOFT_MAGIC_COMMA lexical
    3839             : escape and a comma can be inserted and *add_escape is set to TRUE,
    3840             : indicating to the caller the need to do so.  This lexical escape allows
    3841             : skip_white_space to determine when the text is rescanned whether the comma
    3842             : will be suppressed or not in the expanded text.  *add_escape is set to
    3843             : FALSE in all other cases.
    3844             : */
    3845             : {
    3846           0 :   sizeof_t             arg_number;
    3847             :   /* Move to the next section, skipping the rt_paste or
    3848             :      rt_microsoft_magic_arg_marker placeholder. */
    3849           0 :   char                 *ahead = rtp+1;
    3850           0 :   a_repl_text_seq_kind rtp_op = (a_repl_text_seq_kind)*rtp;
    3851           0 :   a_repl_text_seq_kind next_op;
    3852             : 
    3853           0 :   *add_escape = FALSE;
    3854           0 :   get_macro_repl_text_number(arg_number, ahead);
    3855           0 :   next_op = (a_repl_text_seq_kind)*(ahead++);
    3856           0 :   if (next_op == rt_raw_argument ||
    3857           0 :       next_op == rt_microsoft_maybe_raw_argument ||
    3858             :       (ms_compat && next_op == rt_argument)) {
    3859             :     /* A macro argument follows the concatenation.  (In Microsoft mode,
    3860             :        the argument is expanded, whether or not preceded by "##".) */
    3861           0 :     a_macro_arg_ptr map;
    3862             : 
    3863           0 :     get_macro_repl_text_number(arg_number, ahead);
    3864           0 :     get_arg_value(arg_number, map);
    3865           0 :     if (arg_number == n_params &&
    3866           0 :         (map->raw_len == 0 ||
    3867             :          (ms_compat && map->expanded_len == 0))) {
    3868             :       /* The last macro parameter (presumably variadic) is empty or missing.
    3869             :          So we adjust the section length to not include the last chunk of
    3870             :          white space characters preceded by a comma: */
    3871           0 :       if (kind == rt_text) {
    3872           0 :         char *back = rtp-1;
    3873             :         /* Skip preceding white space. */
    3874           0 :         while (*back == ' ' || *back == '\t') { --back; }
    3875           0 :         if (rtp_op == rt_microsoft_magic_arg_marker &&
    3876           0 :             back[-1] == LE_ESCAPE && back[0] == LE_END_OF_TOKEN) {
    3877             :           /* Unlike rt_paste, rt_microsoft_magic_arg_marker does not
    3878             :              suppress a preceding end-of-token marker. */
    3879           0 :           back -= LE_ESCAPE_LEN;
    3880             :         }  /* if */
    3881           0 :         if (*back == ',') {
    3882           0 :           *length -= (rtp-back);
    3883           0 :           if (microsoft_mode) {
    3884             :             /* Leave space for an LE_MICROSOFT_MAGIC_COMMA escape and a
    3885             :                comma to be inserted and indicate the need to do so. */
    3886             :             *length += LE_ESCAPE_LEN + 1;
    3887             :             *add_escape = TRUE;
    3888             :           }  /* if */
    3889             :         }  /* if */
    3890             :       }  /* if */
    3891             :     }  /* if */
    3892             :   }  /* if */
    3893           0 : }  /* adjust_length_for_magic_arg */
    3894             : 
    3895             : 
    3896      497639 : static sizeof_t length_of_replacement_text(char            *rtp,

    3899             :                                            a_macro_arg_ptr *arg_values)
    3900             : /*

    4028      586630 : void adjust_deletion_counts(a_const_char *line_loc,
    4029             :                             sizeof_t     deletion_len)
    4030             : /*
    4031             : The text beginning at line_loc is being replaced.  If the text being
    4032             : replaced is in the part of the macro buffer that is subject to compaction,
    4033             : adjust the running count of deleted text in the buffer and in the source
    4034             : line modification whose inserted text contains line_loc to account for the
    4035             : removal of deletion_len characters (less one for the ATTENTION_MARKER
    4036             : character, which will remain after compaction).
    4037             : */
    4038             : {
    4039      586630 :   if (ptr_in_range(line_loc, macro_buffer + num_compacted_macro_buffer_chars,
    4040             :                    after_end_of_macro_buffer)) {
    4041             :     /* The text being replaced is in the portion of macro_buffer that is
    4042             :        subject to compaction. */
    4043      151662 :     a_source_line_modif_ptr slmp = assoc_source_line_modif(line_loc);
    4044      151662 :     if (memchr(line_loc + 1, ATTENTION_MARKER, deletion_len - 1) != NULL) {
    4045             :       /* The text being replaced already contains a replacement, so this
    4046             :          replacement supersedes that one.  Remove the portion of the
    4047             :          count of deleted characters in macro_buffer due to the earlier
    4048             :          replacement and substitute this count for the previous one in
    4049             :          the source line modification.  (Note: this is a conservative
    4050             :          calculation and will underestimate the number of deleted
    4051             :          characters in macro_buffer if there are other replacements in
    4052             :          the inserted text of this modification outside the range of the
    4053             :          new replacement.  That is a safe error, however, since it only
    4054             :          means that macro_buffer might be expanded when it could
    4055             :          otherwise simply have been compacted.  It is thus not worth the
    4056             :          time and complexity to get the count exactly right in this
    4057             :          case.) */
    4058           0 :       num_chars_deleted_in_macro_buffer -= slmp->num_deleted_chars;
    4059           0 :       slmp->num_deleted_chars = deletion_len - 1;
    4060             :     } else {
    4061             :       /* Any previous deletions in this modification's inserted text are
    4062             :          outside the range currently being replaced, so this deletion
    4063             :          count is in addition to those. */
    4064      151662 :       slmp->num_deleted_chars += deletion_len - 1;
    4065             :     }  /* if */
    4066      151662 :     num_chars_deleted_in_macro_buffer += deletion_len - 1;

    4071             : /*

    4606             : 
    4607             : #define NUM_FEATURES (sizeof(feature_support_list) / sizeof(a_feature_support))
    4608             : 
    4609             : #if BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C
    4610             : BEGIN_EXTERN_C_BLOCK
    4611             : #endif /* BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C */
    4612             : 
    4613           0 : static int compare_feature_names(a_const_void_ptr id_ptr,
    4614             :                                  a_const_void_ptr feature_ptr)
    4615             : /*
    4616             : Function used by bsearch to compare the identifier to which id_ptr points
    4617             : with the clang_name of the feature to which feature_ptr points.
    4618             : */
    4619             : {
    4620           0 :   int result = strcmp((const char *)id_ptr,
    4621           0 :                       ((a_feature_support *)feature_ptr)->clang_name);
    4622           0 :   return result;
    4623             : }  /* compare_feature_names */
    4624             : 
    4625             : #if BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C
    4626             : END_EXTERN_C_BLOCK
    4627             : #endif /* BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C */
    4628             : 
    4629             : /*
    4630             : The following table (sorted for use with bsearch) has one entry for each
    4631             : type trait helper function for which support can be tested using the clang
    4632             : __has_feature/__has_extension macros.  Although the clang documentation
    4633             : says that these can be tested only by __has_extension and not by
    4634             : __has_feature, current clang versions treat the two macros identically in
    4635             : this regard.  This list is maintained separately from the list of features
    4636             : to facilitate emulation of a potential future version of clang that does
    4637             : implement the documented distinction.  This list reflects clang version
    4638             : 3.5.
    4639             : */
    4640             : static a_const_char *clang_type_traits_helpers[] = {
    4641             :   "has_nothrow_assign",
    4642             :   "has_nothrow_constructor",
    4643             :   "has_nothrow_copy",
    4644             :   "has_trivial_assign",
    4645             :   "has_trivial_constructor",
    4646             :   "has_trivial_copy",
    4647             :   "has_trivial_destructor",
    4648             :   "has_virtual_destructor",
    4649             :   "is_abstract",
    4650             :   "is_aggregate",
    4651             :   "is_base_of",
    4652             :   "is_class",
    4653             :   "is_convertible_to",
    4654             :   "is_empty",
    4655             :   "is_enum",
    4656             :   "is_final",
    4657             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4658             :   "is_interface_class",
    4659             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4660             :   /* The front end supports __is_literal_type, as does clang, but the
    4661             :      __has_feature/__has_extension macros only allow testing for
    4662             :      __is_literal, which is supported by clang but not by the front end.
    4663             :      Hence we omit: */
    4664             :   /* "is_literal", */
    4665             :   "is_pod",
    4666             :   "is_polymorphic",
    4667             :   "is_standard_layout",
    4668             :   "is_trivial",
    4669             :   "is_trivially_assignable",
    4670             :   "is_trivially_constructible",
    4671             :   "is_trivially_copyable",
    4672             :   "is_union",
    4673             :   "underlying_type"
    4674             : };
    4675             : 
    4676             : #define NUM_CLANG_TYPE_TRAITS \
    4677             :   (sizeof(clang_type_traits_helpers) / sizeof(a_const_char *))
    4678             : 
    4679             : /*
    4680             : Size of a buffer large enough to contain any supported feature name
    4681             : (including optional leading/trailing double underscores) and a terminating
    4682             : null character.
    4683             : */
    4684             : #define MAX_CLANG_FEATURE_NAME_LEN 64
    4685             : 
    4686             : #if BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C
    4687             : BEGIN_EXTERN_C_BLOCK
    4688             : #endif /* BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C */
    4689             : 
    4690           0 : static int compare_type_traits_helper_names(a_const_void_ptr id_ptr,
    4691             :                                             a_const_void_ptr helper_ptr)
    4692             : /*
    4693             : Function used by bsearch to compare the identifier to which id_ptr points
    4694             : with the type traits helper name to which helper_ptr points.
    4695             : */
    4696             : {
    4697           0 :   int result = strcmp((const char *)id_ptr, *(const char **)helper_ptr);
    4698           0 :   return result;
    4699             : }  /* compare_type_traits_helper_names */
    4700             : 
    4701             : #if BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C
    4702             : END_EXTERN_C_BLOCK
    4703             : #endif /* BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C */
    4704             : 
    4705             : /*
    4706             : The following struct associates a standard attribute-token with the value
    4707             : returned by __has_cpp_attribute for that token.
    4708             : */
    4709             : 
    4710             : typedef struct a_cpp_attribute_support {
    4711             :   a_const_char
    4712             :         *token;         /* The spelling of the attribute-token. */
    4713             :   a_const_char
    4714             :         *value;         /* The value of __has_cpp_attribute applied to the
    4715             :                            token. */
    4716             : } a_cpp_attribute_support;
    4717             : 
    4718             : /*
    4719             : The following array describes all the standard attribute-tokens with the
    4720             : value returned by __has_cpp_attribute for that token.  The entries are
    4721             : sorted by the token spelling so it can be used with bsearch.
    4722             : */
    4723             : 
    4724             : static a_cpp_attribute_support attribute_support_list[] = {
    4725             :   { "carries_dependency",
    4726             :     "200809" },
    4727             :   { "deprecated",
    4728             :     "201309" },
    4729             :   { "fallthrough",
    4730             :     "201603" },
    4731             :   { "maybe_unused",
    4732             :     "201603" },
    4733             :   { "nodiscard",
    4734             :     "201603" },
    4735             :   { "noreturn",
    4736             :     "200709" }
    4737             : };
    4738             : 
    4739             : #define NUM_CPP_ATTRIBUTES (sizeof(attribute_support_list) / \
    4740             :                             sizeof(a_cpp_attribute_support))
    4741             : 
    4742             : #if BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C
    4743             : BEGIN_EXTERN_C_BLOCK
    4744             : #endif /* BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C */
    4745             : 
    4746           0 : static int compare_attribute_names(a_const_void_ptr id_ptr,
    4747             :                                    a_const_void_ptr attr_supp_ptr)
    4748             : /*
    4749             : Function used by bsearch to compare the attribute-token to which id_ptr
    4750             : points with the attribute-token spelling of the attribute support entry to
    4751             : which attr_supp_ptr points.
    4752             : */
    4753             : {
    4754           0 :   int result = strcmp((const char *)id_ptr,
    4755           0 :                       ((a_cpp_attribute_support *)attr_supp_ptr)->token);
    4756           0 :   return result;
    4757             : }  /* compare_attribute_names */
    4758             : 
    4759             : #if BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C
    4760             : END_EXTERN_C_BLOCK
    4761             : #endif /* BSEARCH_QSORT_FUNCTION_IS_EXTERN_C */
    4762             : 
    4763             : static a_const_char *clang_feature_test_id(a_macro_arg_ptr   macro_arg,
    4764             :                                            a_source_position *error_pos)
    4765             : /*
    4766             : macro_arg is the argument of a clang feature-test macro (__has_feature,
    4767             : __has_extension, __has_attribute, or __has_builtin); whether the raw_text
    4768             : or expanded_text is used depends on the value of clang_version.  The
    4769             : argument must be an identifier, which means that either the text is an
    4770             : identifier or (if the expanded text is being used) its first character is
    4771             : an ATTENTION_MARKER denoting the expansion of a macro invocation, which
    4772             : might itself be the expansion of a macro invocation, etc.  If the ultimate
    4773             : expansion is not a simple identifier, report an error at error_pos and
    4774             : return NULL.  Otherwise, return a pointer to the identifier (after
    4775             : stripping leading/trailing double-underscores, if present).  The returned
    4776             : pointer may point into a local buffer, which will be overwritten by
    4777             : subsequent calls.
    4778             : */
    4779             : {
    4780             :   a_source_line_modif_ptr slmp;
    4781             :   int                     char_len;

    4872             : static a_boolean same_macro_at_beginning(a_source_line_modif_ptr slmp,
    4873             :                                          a_const_char            *str)
    4874             : /*
    4875             : slmp is a source line modification containing the expansion of a previous
    4876             : macro invocation; str designates the expansion of a potential invocation of

    5243             :         /* The identifier does appear within its own expansion. */
    5244          46 :         if (!pcc_preprocessing_mode) {
    5245             :           if (ms_compat) {
    5246             :             /* In some cases, the Microsoft preprocessor expands a macro
    5247             :                invocation appearing in the expansion of an earlier
    5248             :                invocation of the same macro.  For example:
    5249             : 
    5250             :                  #define invoke(M, arg) M arg
    5251             :                  #define X(arg) invoke(Y, (arg))
    5252             :                  #define Z invoke(X, (0))
    5253             : 
    5254             :                Here, the expansion of "invoke(X, (0))" contains an
    5255             :                invocation of "invoke" with a different macro.  The standard
    5256             :                rules would mark the second invocation of "invoke" as inert;
    5257             :                the Microsoft preprocessor expands it.  It does not expand
    5258             :                the second invocation if the invoked macro is the same,
    5259             :                which would result in unbounded recursion; if the example is
    5260             :                changed to
    5261             : 
    5262             :                  #define X(arg) invoke(X, (arg))
    5263             : 
    5264             :                the Microsoft preprocessor leaves the second invocation
    5265             :                unexpanded, apparently basing the decision on whether the
    5266             :                previous expansion began with a macro invocation and the
    5267             :                current expansion begins with the same macro name.  The
    5268             :                Microsoft preprocessor also does not expand the second
    5269             :                invocation if the first appeared directly in the source
    5270             :                code; that is, given
    5271             : 
    5272             :                  #define Y(arg) arg
    5273             :                  invoke(X, (0));
    5274             :                  Z;
    5275             : 
    5276             :                the direct invocation of "invoke" expands to "invoke(Y(0))"
    5277             :                while the invocation of "Z" yields "0". */
    5278             :             if (mdp->object_like) {
    5279             :               /* An object-like macro name appearing in its own expansion
    5280             :                  would always be an unbounded recursion. */
    5281             :               is_inert_macro = TRUE;
    5282             :             } else if (parent_source_line_modif(slmp) == NULL) {

    6016             :           /* Generate a warning on an empty macro argument, since that
    6017             :              is "undefined" behavior according to the standard.  Do not
    6018             :              generate the diagnostic if the argument was ended because of
    6019             :              the end of source or of a preprocessing directive.  This
    6020             :              is a warning instead of a strict ANSI diagnostic because this
    6021             :              is "undefined" and not illegal.  In C99 and C++11, empty macro
    6022             :              arguments are valid. */
    6023      225965 :           if (map->raw_len == 0 &&

    6027             :             }  /* if */

    6049             :                current token, overwriting the token's LE_ESCAPE character
    6050             :                with an ATTENTION_MARKER and possibly causing an error in

    6060             :              (but still fetching pp-tokens).  Note that the standard
    6061             :              requires that a macro argument be macro-expanded in
    6062             :              isolation, without any of the tokens following it.  We
    6063             :              implement that by setting the is_isolated_text flag
    6064             :              so that the scan will stop at the end of the insertion. */
    6065             :           /* It's not possible to rescan the raw argument entirely from
    6066             :              the original source because we may have advanced to a new source

    6069             :              that we get the proper context for macro inertness checking
    6070             :              (they're in macro_buffer, so they have not disappeared).

    6147             : 
    6148             :                        #define Q(x) M(x)

    7137             :         /* The result reflects concatenating two non-empty text sections.

    7378      729914 : static a_token_kind mdefn_get_token(a_macro_param_ptr param_list,
    7379             :                                     sizeof_t          *param_num,
    7380             :                                     a_macro_param_ptr *param_ptr,
    7381             :                                     a_boolean         *any_white_space_skipped)
    7382             : /*
    7383             : A functional analogue of get_token, which checks identifiers to see if
    7384             : they are macro parameters on the given list.  If so, *param_num is set
    7385             : to the parameter number (the first parameter is numbered 1) and *param_ptr
    7386             : is set to point to the parameter entry.  Otherwise (including when the
    7387             : token is not an identifier), *param_num is set to 0 and *param_ptr is
    7388             : set to NULL.  Return *any_white_space_skipped == TRUE if any white
    7389             : space was skipped before the token.  This routine is used while
    7390             : fetching the replacement text of macro definitions.  This routine also
    7391             : implements the cpp practice of finding macro arguments within the text
    7392             : of string literals and character constants (see end_of_cpp_string,
    7393             : start_of_white_space_in_cpp_string).

    7526             : /*

    7532             : { ensure_macro_buffer_space(1+NUM_BYTES_IN_MULTI_BYTE_REPL_TEXT_NUMBER); \
    7533             :   *next_avail_in_macro_buffer++ = (char)(kind);                         \
    7534             :   put_macro_repl_text_number(number, next_avail_in_macro_buffer);     \
    7535             : }  /* put_start_of_section */
    7536             : 
    7537             : /*
    7538             : Similar to put_start_of_section, but for non-text sections.  Terminates
    7539             : any text section underway.
    7540             : */
    7541             : #define put_start_of_non_text_section(kind, number)                   \
    7542             : { curr_text_section = NULL;                                           \
    7543             :   put_start_of_section(kind, number);                                 \
    7544             : }  /* put_start_of_non_text_section */
    7545             : 
    7546             : 
    7547      819510 : static void put_raw_text(a_const_char *str,
    7548             :                          sizeof_t     length,
    7549             :                          char         **curr_text_section)

    7554             : text section, if there is one, or is NULL otherwise.

    7600             : 
    7601             : static void make_definition_string(a_symbol_ptr macro_sym)
    7602             : /*
    7603             : Create a string in the temp_text_buffer representing the definition of the
    7604             : macro described by macro_sym, i.e., "#define <name> <replacement>".
    7605             : */
    7606             : {
    7607             :   a_macro_def_ptr      mdp = macro_sym->variant.macro_def;
    7608             :   a_macro_param_ptr    pp;
    7609             :   a_repl_text_seq_kind rts_kind;
    7610             :   sizeof_t             rts_number;
    7611             :   char                 *ptr;
    7612             : 
    7613             :   pos_in_temp_text_buffer = 0;
    7614             :   if (mdp->repl_text == NULL) {
    7615             :     /* Predefined macros, like __LINE__ and __FILE__, whose replacement text
    7616             :        varies between invocations, have a NULL replacement text and will be
    7617             :        identified in the IL by an empty string (not even "#define"). */
    7618             :   } else {
    7619             :     /* Put out #define. */
    7620             :     put_str_to_temp_text_buffer("#define ");
    7621             :     /* Put out the macro name. */
    7622             :     put_str_to_temp_text_buffer(macro_sym->header->identifier);
    7623             :     /* If the macro is function-like, put out the parameters. */
    7624             :     if (!mdp->object_like) {
    7625             :       put_ch_to_temp_text_buffer('(');
    7626             :       for (pp = mdp->param_list; pp != NULL; pp = pp->next) {
    7627             :         /* Put out a macro parameter name. */
    7628             :         if (mdp->variadic && pp->next == NULL) {
    7629             :           /* This is a variadic parameter (declared with an ellipsis). */

    7631             :             /* Generate a variadic macro name as in "M(x, y, z...)". */
    7632             :             put_str_to_temp_text_buffer(pp->name);
    7633             :           }  /* if */
    7634             :           put_str_to_temp_text_buffer("...");
    7635             :         } else {
    7636             :           /* The normal case of a nonvariadic macro parameter. */
    7637             :           put_str_to_temp_text_buffer(pp->name);
    7638             :         }  /* if */
    7639             :         /* There are more parameters, so put out a comma separator. */
    7640             :         if (pp->next != NULL) put_ch_to_temp_text_buffer(',');
    7641             :       }  /* for */
    7642             :       put_ch_to_temp_text_buffer(')');
    7643             :     }  /* if */
    7644             :     put_ch_to_temp_text_buffer(' ');
    7645             :     /* Put out the macro body, converting from the internal form to a plain
    7646             :        string. */
    7647             :     for (ptr = mdp->repl_text; *ptr != (int)rt_null;) {
    7648             :       rts_kind = (a_repl_text_seq_kind)*(ptr++);
    7649             :       /* Extract the section length or argument number. */
    7650             :       get_macro_repl_text_number(rts_number, ptr);
    7651             :       switch (rts_kind) {
    7652             :         case rt_text:
    7653             :           /* Raw text.  rts_number gives its length.  Copy the text, ignoring
    7654             :              end-of-token markers. */

    7657             :             char ch = *ptr++;

    7659             :               if (*ptr == LE_NULL) {
    7660             :                 /* Null (zero) character in line. */

    7662             :               } else {
    7663             :                 /* End of token marker, ignored. */
    7664             :                 check_assertion_str(*ptr == LE_END_OF_TOKEN,
    7665             :                                     "make_il_macro_entry: bad lexical escape");

    7675             :         case rt_microsoft_maybe_raw_argument:

    7698             :           break;
