    7867             : 
    7868             : static a_boolean equiv_replacement_text(char            *repl_text,
    7869             :                                         sizeof_t        repl_text_length,
    7870             :                                         a_macro_def_ptr mdp)
    7871             : /*
    7872             : Return TRUE if the replacement text specified by repl_text, with a length
    7873             : of repl_text_length, is the same as that of the macro definition mdp,
    7874             : ignoring extra LE_END_OF_TOKEN escapes appearing in repl_text.  Note that
    7875             : repl_text_length does not include the rt_null terminator.
    7876             : */
    7877             : {
    7878             :   a_boolean     result = FALSE;
    7879             : 
    7880             :   check_assertion(repl_text != NULL);
    7881             :   if (mdp->repl_text != NULL) {
    7882             :     /* Step through the two replacement text strings, skipping over
    7883             :        LE_END_OF_TOKEN escapes that appear in repl_text but not in the
    7884             :        original replacement text, and ignoring the respective lengths of
    7885             :        rt_text sections (which can be different because of the presence of
    7886             :        LE_END_OF_TOKEN escapes).  (This difference can occur because of
    7887             :        predefined macros inserted programmatically, which typically will
    7888             :        not have LE_END_OF_TOKEN escapes, and those coming from the
    7889             :        predefined macro file, which are handled via proc_define and thus
    7890             :        might have them.) */
    7891             :     sizeof_t  orig_idx;
    7892             :     sizeof_t  new_idx;
    7893             :     a_boolean mismatch_seen = FALSE;
    7894             :     for (orig_idx = 0, new_idx = 0;
    7895             :          !mismatch_seen && new_idx < repl_text_length;
    7896             :          ++orig_idx, ++new_idx) {
    7897             :       char ch = repl_text[new_idx];
    7898             :       if (ch != mdp->repl_text[orig_idx]) {
    7899             :         if (ch == LE_ESCAPE &&
    7900             :             repl_text[new_idx + 1] == LE_END_OF_TOKEN) {
    7901             :           /* An LE_END_OF_TOKEN escape in repl_text.  Skip over it and
    7902             :              check that the following character matches. */
    7903             :           new_idx += LE_ESCAPE_LEN;
    7904             :           mismatch_seen = (repl_text[new_idx] != mdp->repl_text[orig_idx]);
    7905             :         } else {
    7906             :           mismatch_seen = TRUE;
    7907             :         }  /* if */
    7908             :       } else if (ch == (char)rt_text) {
    7909             :         /* Don't check the length of rt_text sections, which can be
    7910             :            different because of extra LE_END_OF_TOKEN escapes.  A real
    7911             :            mismatch causing a length difference will be caught while
    7912             :            comparing the text itself. */
    7913             :         new_idx += 3;
    7914             :         orig_idx += 3;
    7915             :       } else if (ch == (char)rt_raw_argument ||
    7916             :                  ch == (char)rt_stringized_raw_argument ||
    7917             :                  ch == (char)rt_charized_raw_argument ||
    7918             :                  ch == (char)rt_argument ||
    7919             :                  ch == (char)rt_microsoft_maybe_raw_argument) {
    7920             :         /* Check to ensure the argument number matches, then skip over
    7921             :            it. */
    7922             :         mismatch_seen =
    7923             :                     !(repl_text[new_idx + 1] == mdp->repl_text[orig_idx + 1] &&
    7924             :                       repl_text[new_idx + 2] == mdp->repl_text[orig_idx + 2] &&
    7925             :                       repl_text[new_idx + 3] == mdp->repl_text[orig_idx + 3]);
    7926             :         new_idx += 3;
    7927             :         orig_idx += 3;
    7928             :       } else if (ch == (char)rt_paste ||
    7929             :                  ch == (char)rt_microsoft_magic_arg_marker) {
    7930             :         /* These take no parameter, so a dummy value of 0 was added.  Skip
    7931             :            over it. */
    7932             :         new_idx += 3;
    7933             :         orig_idx += 3;
    7934             :       } else if (ch == LE_ESCAPE) {
    7935             :         /* Check to make sure it's the same escape, then skip over it. */
    7936             :         mismatch_seen = repl_text[new_idx + 1] != mdp->repl_text[orig_idx + 1];
    7937             :         ++new_idx;
    7938             :         ++orig_idx;
    7939             :       }  /* if */
    7940             :     }  /* for */
    7941             :     result = (!mismatch_seen &&
    7942             :               mdp->repl_text[orig_idx] == (char)rt_null);
    7943             :   }  /* if */
    7944             :   return result;
    7945             : }  /* equiv_replacement_text */
    7946             : 
    7947             : 
    7948      241881 : a_symbol_ptr proc_define(void)
    7949             : /*
    7950             : Scan and process a #define directive.
    7951             : */
    7952             : {
    7953      241881 :   sizeof_t        repl_text_len;
    7954      241881 :   char            *repl_text;
    7955      241881 :   a_macro_def_ptr mdp;
    7956      241881 :   a_symbol_ptr    assoc_symbol = NULL;
    7957      241881 :   a_boolean       any_white_space_skipped;
    7958      241881 :   sizeof_t        param_num;
    7959      241881 :   sizeof_t        save_param_num;
    7960      241881 :   sizeof_t        n_params = 0;
    7961      241881 :   a_macro_param_ptr
    7962             :                   param_ptr,
    7963             :                   save_param_ptr,
    7964             :                   pp,
    7965             :                   pp2,
    7966             :                   last_param,
    7967             :                   param_list;
    7968      241881 :   a_boolean       object_like;
    7969      241881 :   a_boolean       variadic = FALSE;
    7970      241881 :   a_boolean       redefinition = FALSE;
    7971      241881 :   a_source_position
    7972             :                   start_pos;

    8811           0 : static char *collect_optional_assert_token_sequence(a_boolean *err)
    8812             : /*
    8813             : Collect the optional token-sequence for an #assert or #unassert as a character
    8814             : string in temp_text_buffer, and return a pointer to the beginning of the
    8815             : (null-terminated) string.  Return NULL if there was no token sequence.
    8816             : The caller must know that temp_text_buffer is not in use currently.
    8817             : Return *err TRUE if there was some error.
    8818             : */
    8819             : {
    8820           0 :   char          *start_loc = NULL;
    8821           0 :   unsigned long paren_count;
    8822           0 :   sizeof_t      offset;
    8823             : 
    8824           0 :   *err = FALSE;
    8825             :   /* The directive can end here, after the name, or there can be a list
    8826             :      of tokens enclosed in parentheses. */

    8828             :     /* The directive ends with the predicate name, as in "#assert name". */
    8829           0 :   } else if (curr_token != tok_lparen) {
    8830             :     /* Error -- expected a left parenthesis. */
    8831           0 :     pos_error(ec_exp_lparen, &error_position);
    8832           0 :     *err = TRUE;
    8833             :   } else {
    8834             :     /* The opening parenthesis is present.  Scan the tokens until the
    8835             :        closing parenthesis. */
    8836           0 :     paren_count = 0;
    8837             :     /* temp_text_buffer starts out empty. */
    8838           0 :     pos_in_temp_text_buffer = 0;
    8839           0 :     while (get_token() != tok_newline && curr_token != tok_end_of_source) {
    8840             :       /* Count parentheses within the loop, because nested parentheses
    8841             :          matter, as in

    8843             :       */

    8845           0 :       if (curr_token == tok_rparen) {
    8846             :         /* Exit the loop on the proper closing parenthesis. */
    8847           0 :         if (paren_count == 0) break;
    8848           0 :         paren_count--;
    8849           0 :       } else if (curr_token == tok_lparen) {
    8850           0 :         paren_count++;
    8851             :       }  /* if */
    8852             :       /* Put the text of the current token and a blank (as a token separator)
    8853             :          into temp_text_buffer.  White space is not significant and is not
    8854             :          saved. */
    8855           0 :       for (offset = 0; offset < len_of_curr_token; offset++) {
    8856           0 :         put_ch_to_temp_text_buffer(start_of_curr_token[offset]);

    8858           0 :       put_ch_to_temp_text_buffer(' ');
    8859             :     }  /* while */

    8861           0 :     put_ch_to_temp_text_buffer('\0');

    8863             :        token-sequence. */
    8864           0 :     start_loc = temp_text_buffer;
    8865             :     /* Check for the closing parenthesis. */
    8866           0 :     if (!required_token(tok_rparen, ec_exp_rparen)) *err = TRUE;
    8867             :   }  /* if */
    8868           0 :   return start_loc;
    8869             : }  /* collect_optional_assert_token_sequence */

    8871             : 
    8872           0 : static an_assert_value_ptr find_assert_value(an_assert_predicate_ptr app,
    8873             :                                              a_const_char            *value,
    8874             :                                              an_assert_value_ptr     *prev_avp)
    8875             : /*
    8876             : Look for an existing value of the #assert predicate indicated by app that
    8877             : matches value.  If one is found, return a pointer to it, and set *prev_avp to

    8879             : first on the list.  If no appropriate value entry is found, return NULL.

    8883             :

    8889           0 :   return ptr;

    8891             : 
    8892             : 
    8893           0 : static void add_assert_value(a_const_char            *value,
    8894             :                              an_assert_predicate_ptr app)
    8895             : /*

    8897             : front of the value list for the predicate pointed to by app.  value is

    8914             : 
    8915           0 : void proc_assert(void)
    8916             : /*
    8917             : Scan and process an #assert directive.  This is an AT&T extension in System V
    8918             : release 4.  Its form is
    8919             : 
    8920             :   #assert name ( token-list )
    8921             : 
    8922             : or
    8923             : 
    8924             :   #assert name
    8925             : 
    8926             : The defined name can be tested in #if expressions by writing
    8927             : 
    8928             :   #if #name( token-list )
    8929             : 
    8930             : which is true if one of the asserted values of #name is the indicated
    8931             : token-list.
    8932             : */
    8933             : {
    8934           0 :   an_assert_predicate_ptr predicate_entry = NULL;
    8935           0 :   char                    *token_str = NULL;
    8936           0 :   a_boolean               err = FALSE;
    8937             : 
    8938           0 :   db_enter(3, "proc_assert");
    8939             :   /* Get the predicate identifier. */
    8940           0 :   if (get_token() != tok_identifier) {
    8941             :     /* Error -- expected an identifier. */
    8942           0 :     pos_error(ec_exp_identifier, &error_position);
    8943           0 :     err = TRUE;
    8944             :   } else {
    8945             :     /* The identifier __VA_ARGS__ is not allowed if variadic macros are
    8946             :        accepted. */
    8947           0 :     check_use_of_VA_ARGS(len_of_curr_token, start_of_curr_token);
    8948             :     /* Find or make a predicate entry for the name. */
    8949           0 :     predicate_entry = find_or_make_predicate_entry(start_of_curr_token,
    8950             :                                                    len_of_curr_token);
    8951             :     /* Collect the optional token sequence in temp_text_buffer. */
    8952           0 :     token_str = collect_optional_assert_token_sequence(&err);
    8953             :   }  /* if */
    8954             :   /* If there was no error, install the assertion value. */
    8955           0 :   if (err) {
    8956           0 :     some_error_in_curr_directive = TRUE;
    8957             :   } else {
    8958             : #if DEBUG
    8959           0 :     if (debug_level >= 3) {
    8960           0 :       fprintf(f_debug, "Processing #assert %s", predicate_entry->name);
    8961           0 :       if (token_str != NULL) fprintf(f_debug, " ( %s )", token_str);
    8962           0 :       fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
    8963             :     }  /* if */
    8964             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    8965             :     /* Only add a value if there was a token sequence. */
    8966           0 :     if (token_str != NULL) add_assert_value(token_str, predicate_entry);

    8972           0 : void proc_unassert(void)

    8978             :

    9002           0 :     token_str = collect_optional_assert_token_sequence(&err);

    9029             :            value. */

    9037             :             /* The value is first on the list. */

    9048             : 
    9049             : 
    9050           0 : static an_assert_value_ptr next_matching_assert_value(
    9051             :                                              an_assert_value_ptr matched_value,
    9052             :                                              sizeof_t            matched_len)
    9053             : /*
    9054             : The #assert predicate value being scanned matches the first matched_len
    9055             : characters of the assert value matched_value.  However, we have discovered
    9056             : that the following characters do not match, so advance to the next value
    9057             : on the list that begins with the same characters, and return a pointer
    9058             : to it.  If there is no such value, return NULL.
    9059             : */
    9060             : {
    9061           0 :   an_assert_value_ptr old_matched_value = matched_value;
    9062             : 
    9063           0 :   while ((matched_value = matched_value->next) != NULL) {
    9064           0 :     if (smemcmp(matched_value->value, old_matched_value->value,
    9065             :                 matched_len) == 0) {
    9066             :       break;
    9067             :     }  /* if */
    9068             :   }  /* for */
    9069           0 :   return matched_value;
    9070             : }  /* next_matching_assert_value */
    9071             : 
    9072             : 
    9073           0 : void scan_assert_predicate_reference(a_boolean *rescan)
    9074             : /*
    9075             : Scan a reference to an #assert predicate in a preprocessing #if.  Its form
    9076             : is
    9077             : 
    9078             :   #name(token-sequence)
    9079             : 
    9080             : The current character position is after the "#".  start_of_curr_token
    9081             : points to the "#".  On return, either *rescan == TRUE and the input has
    9082             : been replaced with "0" or "1" to indicate whether the token-sequence
    9083             : exists as a value for the #assert predicate, and the current token
    9084             : should be rescanned; or an error has been issued and *rescan == FALSE,
    9085             : and processing should continue in sequence.
    9086             : */
    9087             : {
    9088           0 :   a_boolean               result = FALSE;
    9089           0 :   a_boolean               save_fetch_pp_tokens = fetch_pp_tokens;
    9090           0 :   a_boolean               save_expand_macros = expand_macros;
    9091           0 :   an_assert_predicate_ptr app, prev_app;
    9092           0 :   an_assert_value_ptr     matched_value;
    9093           0 :   sizeof_t                matched_len;
    9094           0 :   char                    *after_matched_str;
    9095           0 :   unsigned long           paren_count;
    9096           0 :   a_boolean               err = FALSE;
    9097             : #if FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS
    9098           0 :   a_source_position       start_pos;
    9099             : #endif /* FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS */
    9100             : 
    9101           0 :   db_enter(4, "scan_assert_predicate_reference");
    9102           0 :   *rescan = FALSE;
    9103           0 :   check_assertion(delete_source_from_loc == NULL);
    9104           0 :   delete_source_from_loc = start_of_curr_token;
    9105           0 :   fetch_pp_tokens = TRUE;
    9106           0 :   expand_macros = FALSE;
    9107             : #if FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS
    9108           0 :   conv_line_loc_to_source_pos(start_of_curr_token, &start_pos);
    9109             : #endif /* FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS */
    9110           0 :   if (get_token() != tok_identifier) {
    9111             :     /* Error -- expected an identifier. */
    9112           0 :     pos_error(ec_exp_identifier, &error_position);
    9113           0 :     err = some_error_in_curr_directive = TRUE;
    9114             :   } else {
    9115             :     /* Look up the predicate name. */
    9116           0 :     app = find_predicate_entry(start_of_curr_token, len_of_curr_token,
    9117             :                                &prev_app);
    9118             :     /* Scan the token list whether or not the predicate name is defined. */
    9119           0 :     if (get_token() != tok_lparen) {
    9120             :       /* Error -- expected a left parenthesis. */
    9121           0 :       pos_error(ec_exp_lparen, &error_position);
    9122           0 :       err = some_error_in_curr_directive = TRUE;
    9123             :     } else {
    9124             :       /* Scan the token sequence.  We don't actually build the token string;
    9125             :          instead, we keep track of the string matched in a value string
    9126             :          so far.  As soon as we can no longer match the text so far to
    9127             :          anything in the values, we give up (the predicate is false). */
    9128             :       /* matched_value points to a value entry, and the assertion is that
    9129             :          the first match_len characters of that value's string match the
    9130             :          token sequence scanned so far (including blanks after each token).
    9131             :          If matched_value == NULL, no value matches the string so far, and
    9132             :          we're just scanning for the closing parenthesis. */
    9133           0 :       matched_value = NULL;
    9134           0 :       if (app != NULL) matched_value = app->values;
    9135             :       matched_len = 0;
    9136             :       paren_count = 0;
    9137             :       /* Get tokens until the closing parenthesis is found. */
    9138           0 :       while (get_token() != tok_newline && curr_token != tok_end_of_source) {
    9139             :         /* Count parentheses within the loop, because nested parentheses
    9140             :            matter, as in
    9141             :              #if  #xyz(aaa(bbb)ccc)
    9142             :         */
    9143             :         /* If you change this, see collect_optional_assert_token_sequence
    9144             :            as well. */
    9145           0 :         if (curr_token == tok_rparen) {
    9146             :           /* Exit the loop on the proper closing parenthesis. */
    9147           0 :           if (paren_count == 0) break;
    9148           0 :           paren_count--;
    9149           0 :         } else if (curr_token == tok_lparen) {
    9150           0 :           paren_count++;
    9151             :         }  /* if */
    9152           0 :         if (matched_value != NULL) {
    9153           0 : try_match_again:
    9154             :           /* See if the text of the token just scanned can be added to the
    9155             :              string matched so far.  Also check for the blank as a token
    9156             :              delimiter after the token string. */
    9157           0 :           after_matched_str = matched_value->value + matched_len;
    9158           0 :           if (smemcmp(after_matched_str,
    9159             :                       start_of_curr_token,
    9160           0 :                       len_of_curr_token) == 0 &&
    9161           0 :               *(after_matched_str+len_of_curr_token) == ' ') {
    9162             :             /* The new token matches the continuation of the matched string,
    9163             :                so change the matched string length to include the added
    9164             :                text. */
    9165           0 :             matched_len += len_of_curr_token+1;
    9166             :           } else {
    9167             :             /* Mismatch.  Look for another value entry later on the list
    9168             :                that starts with the currently matched string, and then try to
    9169             :                match the new token against the continuation of that string. */
    9170           0 :             matched_value = next_matching_assert_value(matched_value,
    9171             :                                                        matched_len);
    9172           0 :             if (matched_value != NULL) goto try_match_again;
    9173             :           }  /* if */
    9174             :         }  /* if */
    9175             :       }  /* while */
    9176             :       /* Check for the closing parenthesis.  required_token cannot be used
    9177             :          because it would do an inappropriate flush on error.  Also, we
    9178             :          don't want to advance to the next token after the ")". */
    9179           0 :       if (curr_token != tok_rparen) {
    9180           0 :         pos_error(ec_exp_rparen, &error_position);
    9181           0 :         err = some_error_in_curr_directive = TRUE;
    9182           0 :         matched_value = NULL;
    9183             :       }  /* if */
    9184             :       /* See whether the assert value we've matched so far ends at this
    9185             :          point. */
    9186           0 :       while (matched_value != NULL &&
    9187           0 :              matched_value->value[matched_len] != '\0') {
    9188             :         /* No, it doesn't.  See whether there is another value that
    9189             :            starts with the same string. */
    9190           0 :         matched_value = next_matching_assert_value(matched_value,
    9191             :                                                    matched_len);
    9192             :       }  /* while */
    9193             :       /* The result is TRUE if we have an entire value string that matches
    9194             :          the entire token sequence (i.e., we have a matching string and
    9195             :          the next thing after it is the terminating null character). */
    9196           0 :       if (matched_value != NULL &&
    9197           0 :           matched_value->value[matched_len] == '\0') result = TRUE;
    9198             :     }  /* if */
    9199             :   }  /* if */
    9200           0 :   if (curr_token != tok_rparen) {
    9201             :     /* If the construct was not properly closed with a right parenthesis,
    9202             :        make the current token (e.g., tok_newline) be scanned again.
    9203             :        Without this, we could run off the end of the #if directive. */
    9204           0 :     curr_char_loc = start_of_curr_token;
    9205           0 :     *rescan = TRUE;
    9206             :   }  /* if */
    9207           0 :   fetch_pp_tokens = save_fetch_pp_tokens;
    9208           0 :   expand_macros = save_expand_macros;
    9209           0 :   if (!err) {
    9210             :     /* Delete the assertion predicate, replacing it by "0" or "1". */
    9211           0 :     a_source_line_modif_ptr slmp;
    9212           0 :     slmp = add_source_line_modif(delete_source_from_loc,
    9213           0 :                                  (sizeof_t)(curr_char_loc -
    9214             :                                                        delete_source_from_loc),
    9215             :                                  (char *)NULL, (char *)NULL);
    9216             :     /* Put the replacement string in the source line modification's inboard
    9217             :        inserted_chars array. */
    9218           0 :     slmp->inserted_chars[0] = result ? '1' : '0';
    9219           0 :     slmp->inserted_chars[1] = LE_ESCAPE;

    9269       11512 : static char *make_repl_text(a_const_char *repl_text,
    9270             :                             sizeof_t     *repl_text_length)
    9271             : /*
    9272             : Make a replacement text string for a macro, corresponding to the raw text
    9273             : given by repl_text.  repl_text == NULL implies an empty replacement string.
    9274             : The length of the repl_text string is returned in *repl_text_length if
    9275             : repl_text_length is not NULL.
    9276             : */
    9277             : {
    9278       11512 :   char     *repl_text_copy, *rtp;
    9279       11512 :   sizeof_t repl_text_len, overhead;
    9280             : 
    9281       11512 :   repl_text_len = (repl_text != NULL) ? strlen(repl_text) : 0;
    9282             :   /* There is always an rt_null at the end of the string.  If the text is
    9283             :      not empty, there is also a header before it. */
    9284       11512 :   overhead = 1;
    9285       11512 :   if (repl_text_len > 0) {
    9286       11512 :     overhead += 1+NUM_BYTES_IN_MULTI_BYTE_REPL_TEXT_NUMBER;
    9287             :   }  /* if */
    9288       11512 :   rtp = repl_text_copy = alloc_fe((sizeof_t)(repl_text_len+overhead));
    9289       11512 :   if (repl_text_len > 0) {
    9290             :     /* Put the kind -- raw text -- in the header. */
    9291       11512 :     *rtp++ = (char)rt_text;
    9292             :     /* Put the length in the header. */
    9293       11512 :     put_macro_repl_text_number(repl_text_len, rtp);
    9294             :     /* Copy the text itself. */
    9295       11512 :     (void)memcpy(rtp, repl_text, size_t_arg(repl_text_len)); /*lint !e668*/
    9296       11512 :     rtp += repl_text_len;
    9297             :   }  /* if */
    9298             :   /* Put the terminator on the string. */
    9299       11512 :   *rtp = (char)rt_null;
    9300             :   /* Return the length of the repl_text_string including the encoded
    9301             :      information in the "overhead" area. */
    9302       11512 :   if (repl_text_length != NULL) *repl_text_length = repl_text_len + overhead;
    9303       11512 :   return(repl_text_copy);
    9304             : }  /* make_repl_text */

    9307       13884 : static a_symbol_ptr enter_predef_macro_full(
    9308             :                                           a_const_char *macro_value,
    9309             :                                           a_const_char *macro_name,
    9310             :                                           a_boolean    cannot_be_redefined,
    9311             :                                           a_boolean    ref_suppresses_pch_file,
    9312             :                                           a_boolean    function_like)
    9313             : /*
    9314             : Enter a predefined macro.  macro_name is the name, macro_value the
    9315             : replacement text string (or NULL for a special macro).  cannot_be_redefined
    9316             : is TRUE if this is a predefined macro that cannot be redefined.
    9317             : ref_suppresses_pch_file is TRUE if a use of the macro should prevent
    9318             : creation of a precompiled header file.  If function_like is TRUE, the macro
    9319             : will be created to accept a single argument that will be macro-expanded;
    9320             : otherwise, the macro will be object-like, taking no argument list.  A
    9321             : pointer to the symbol entry is returned.

    9618           0 :   enter_predef_num_macro_noredef(ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION,

    9620             :   /* Are the ABI changes for RTTI implemented? */

    9652         320 : static void process_command_line_macro_definitions(a_boolean  process_defs,
    9653             :                                                    a_boolean  process_undefs)
    9654             : /*
    9655             : Process a list of macro definitions as requested by "-D" (when process_defs is
    9656             : TRUE) and "-U" (when process_undefs is TRUE) options on the command line.
    9657             : */
    9658             : {
    9659         320 :   a_def_undef_string_ptr  du_ptr = defs_from_cmd_line;
    9660         320 :   a_boolean               save_expand_macros = expand_macros;
    9661         320 :   a_boolean               save_fetch_pp_tokens = fetch_pp_tokens;
    9662             : 
    9663             :   /* Set a current position indicating we are looking at the command line. */
    9664         320 :   set_position_to(pos_curr_token, 0, SP_COL_CMD_LINE);
    9665         320 :   set_err_pos_to_curr_token();
    9666             :   /* Don't expand macros while preprocessing: */
    9667         320 :   expand_macros = FALSE;
    9668         320 :   in_preprocessing_directive = TRUE;
    9669         320 :   fetch_pp_tokens = TRUE;
    9670        3203 :   for (; du_ptr != NULL; du_ptr = du_ptr->next) {
    9671        2883 :     sizeof_t     du_len;
    9672        2883 :     a_const_char *du_str = du_ptr->text, *equal_pos;
    9673        2883 :     if (du_ptr->is_undef && process_undefs) {
    9674             :       /* -U option. */
    9675           0 :       a_boolean  err = FALSE, suppress_error = FALSE;
    9676           0 :       a_symbol_ptr     assoc_symbol;
    9677           0 :       a_symbol_locator locator;
    9678             : #if DEBUG
    9679           0 :       if (debug_level >= 4) {
    9680           0 :         fprintf(f_debug, "Command-line undef: %s\n", du_str);
    9681             :       }  /* if */
    9682             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    9683             :       /* Check the identifier to make sure it is valid. */
    9684           0 :       if (!is_valid_identifier(du_str, (sizeof_t)strlen(du_str), &assoc_symbol,
    9685             :                                &locator)) {
    9686             :         err = TRUE;
    9687             :         /* The Microsoft compiler ignores invalid definitions. */
    9688             :         if (ms_extensions) suppress_error = TRUE;
    9689             :       } else {
    9690           0 :         if (assoc_symbol != NULL) {
    9691           0 :           if (assoc_symbol->variant.macro_def->cannot_be_redefined) {
    9692             :             /* The macro is predefined; one is not allowed to undefine it. */
    9693             :             err = TRUE;

    9695             :             /* Remove the macro's definition.  The a_macro_def entry pointed to
    9696             :                by the symbol is not freed, and is therefore just lost.  */

    9701           0 :       if (err && !suppress_error) {

    9703             :       }  /* if */
    9704        2883 :     } else if (!du_ptr->is_undef && process_defs) {
    9705             :       /* -D option. */
    9706        2883 :       char *p;
    9707        2883 :       if (strchr(du_str, ATTENTION_MARKER) != NULL) {
    9708             :         /* Definition contains a newline character, which cannot be allowed
    9709             :            (it would be confused with a lexical escape character). */
    9710           0 :         str_command_line_error(ec_cl_invalid_macro_definition, du_str);
    9711             :         /* Should not reach here. */
    9712             :       }  /* if */
    9713             :       /* Turn "-D" options into equivalent define directives so that we can
    9714             :          leave the processing to proc_define.  Allocate an extra 2 bytes
    9715             :          for "-D" options that do not contain an equal; they'll be
    9716             :          processed as define id 1 (i.e., a "=1" is appended, and the "="
    9717             :          will be skipped).  During this processing, ensure that diagnostics
    9718             :          are correctly attributed by setting the global variable
    9719             :          curr_cmd_line_or_predef_macro_def.  This is also used by
    9720             :          proc_define to decide that the "=" introducing the macro
    9721             :          definition should be skipped. */
    9722        2883 :       curr_cmd_line_or_predef_macro_def = du_str;
    9723        2883 :       du_len = strlen(du_str);
    9724             :       /* Ensure the buffer holding the logical source line is large enough to
    9725             :          hold the synthetic line we are going to create. */
    9726        2883 :       ensure_min_curr_source_line_length(du_len+2+2*LE_ESCAPE_LEN);
    9727        2883 :       p = (char *)curr_source_line;
    9728        2883 :       strcpy(p, du_str);
    9729        2883 :       equal_pos = strchr(p, '=');
    9730        2883 :       if (equal_pos == NULL) {
    9731             :         /* "-DNAME(X)" becomes "NAME(X)=1". */
    9732        1280 :         if (gnu_mode) {
    9733             :           /* The GNU preprocessor uses " " instead of "=" to prefix the
    9734             :              default replacement text.  This is only significant in cases
    9735             :              where the definition has an implicit "=", such as "-Dx3.9":
    9736             :              the GNU preprocessor treats this as equivalent to
    9737             :              "#define x3 .9 1". */
    9738        1280 :           strcpy(p+du_len, " 1");
    9739             :         } else {
    9740           0 :           strcpy(p+du_len, "=1");
    9741             :         }  /* if */
    9742        1280 :         du_len += 2;
    9743        1603 :       } else if (gnu_mode) {
    9744             :         /* The "=" is optional in the GNU preprocessor command line -- that
    9745             :            is, the GNU preprocessor accepts "-DFOO=BAR", "-DFOO =BAR", and
    9746             :            "-DFOO BAR" -- so replace the "=" with a space to simplify the
    9747             :            processing in proc_define. */
    9748        1603 :         *(char *)equal_pos = ' ';
    9749             :       }  /* if */
    9750        2883 :       p[du_len]   = LE_ESCAPE;
    9751        2883 :       p[du_len+1] = LE_NEWLINE;
    9752        2883 :       p[du_len+2] = LE_ESCAPE;
    9753        2883 :       p[du_len+3] = LE_END_OF_LINE;
    9754        2883 :       curr_char_loc = curr_source_line;
    9755        2883 :       logical_char_info_entries_used = 0;
    9756        2883 :       (void)proc_define();

    9758             :          longer attributed to the command-line option we just processed. */
    9759        2883 :       curr_cmd_line_or_predef_macro_def = NULL;
    9760             :     }  /* if */

    9762         320 :   in_preprocessing_directive = FALSE;
    9763         320 :   fetch_pp_tokens = save_fetch_pp_tokens;
    9764         320 :   expand_macros = save_expand_macros;
    9765             :   /* Set a current position indicating we are in initialization. */
    9766         320 :   set_position_to(pos_curr_token, 0, SP_COL_UNKNOWN);

    9820         320 : static char* expanded_version_string(unsigned long version,
    9821             :                                      a_const_char  *version_string_pattern)
    9822             : /*
    9823             : Allocate and return a buffer containing a copy of version_string_pattern with
    9824             : "%m" expanded to "gcc" or "g++" (depending on the current mode) and "%v"
    9825             : expanded to the specified version of the compiler being emulated.  The caller
    9826             : is responsible to deallocate the buffer using free_general.
    9827             : */
    9828             : {
    9829         320 :   unsigned long  major_num = (unsigned long)(version/10000);
    9830         320 :   unsigned long  minor_num = (unsigned long)((version%10000)/100);
    9831         320 :   unsigned long  patch_num = (unsigned long)(version%100);
    9832         320 :   a_const_char   *src;
    9833         320 :   char           *version_string, *dst;
    9834             : #if CHECKING
    9835         320 :   a_boolean      percent_m_seen = FALSE, percent_v_seen = FALSE;
    9836             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    9837             : 
    9838         320 :   check_assertion_str(gnu_mode &&
    9839             :                       major_num < 100 && minor_num < 100 && patch_num < 100,
    9840         320 :                       "version too large");
    9841         320 :   version_string = (char*)alloc_general(
    9842         320 :                              (sizeof_t)(strlen(version_string_pattern) + 50));
    9843         320 :   src = version_string_pattern;
    9844         320 :   dst = version_string;
    9845        5120 :   for (; *src != '\0'; ++src, ++dst) {
    9846        4480 :     if (*src == '%') {
    9847         640 :       if (*(src+1) == 'm') {
    9848             : #if CHECKING
    9849         320 :         check_assertion_str(!percent_m_seen,
    9850         320 :                             "too many %m in version_string_pattern");
    9851         320 :         percent_m_seen = TRUE;
    9852             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    9853         320 :         ++src;
    9854         320 :         (void)strcpy(dst, gcc_mode ? "gcc" : "g++");
    9855         320 :         dst += 2;
    9856         320 :       } else if (*(src+1) == 'v') {
    9857             : #if CHECKING
    9858         320 :         check_assertion_str(!percent_v_seen,
    9859         320 :                             "too many %v in version_string_pattern");
    9860         320 :         percent_v_seen = TRUE;
    9861             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    9862         320 :         ++src;
    9863         320 :         (void)sprintf(dst, "%lu.%lu", major_num, minor_num);
    9864        1280 :         while (*dst != '\0') ++dst;
    9865         320 :         if (patch_num != 0) {
    9866           0 :           (void)sprintf(dst, ".%lu", patch_num);
    9867           0 :           while (*dst != '\0') ++dst;
    9868             :         }  /* if */
    9869         320 :         --dst;
    9870             :       } else {
    9871           0 :         *dst = *src;
    9872             :       }  /* if */
    9873             :     } else {
    9874        3840 :       *dst = *src;
    9875             :     }  /* if */
    9876             :   }  /* for */
    9877         320 :   *dst = '\0';
    9878         320 :   check_assertion_str(version_string[0] == '"' && dst[-1] == '"',
    9879         320 :                       "version_string_pattern must be quote-delimited string");
    9880         320 :   return version_string;
    9881             : }  /* expanded_version_string */
    9882             :

    9884         320 : static void init_gnu_predefined_macros(void)
    9885             : /*
    9886             : Enter symbols for the predefined macros of GNU/clang C and C++.
    9887             : */
    9888             : {
    9889         320 :   unsigned long  version = clang_mode ? clang_version : gnu_version;
    9890         320 :   unsigned long  major_num = (unsigned long)(version/10000),
    9891         320 :                  minor_num = (unsigned long)((version%10000)/100),
    9892         320 :                  patch_num = (unsigned long)(version%100);
    9893             : 
    9894             :   /* Note that GNU C/C++ permits these macros to be redefined, so we do too. */
    9895         320 :   if (gpp_mode) {
    9896             :     /* In GNU C++ mode (but not in GNU C mode), __GNUG__ is identical to
    9897             :        __GNUC__. */
    9898          66 :     if (!clang_mode) {
    9899          66 :       enter_predef_num_macro(major_num, "__GNUG__");
    9900             :     }  /* if */
    9901          66 :     if (rtti_enabled && gnu_version >= 40300) {
    9902             :       /* g++ introduced the __GXX_RTTI macro in version 4.3.0. */
    9903          66 :       (void)enter_predef_macro("1", "__GXX_RTTI",
    9904             :                                /*cannot_be_redefined=*/FALSE,
    9905             :                                /*ref_suppresses_pch_file=*/FALSE);
    9906             :     }  /* if */
    9907             :   }  /* if */
    9908         320 :   if (gnu_version >= 40103) {
    9909             :     /* GCC 4.1.3 and later define a macro to indicate whether the GNU C89 or
    9910             :        standard C99 rules are in effect for "inline".  GNU C++ 4.1.3+ also
    9911             :        defines one of these macros, although their meaning is not clear in
    9912             :        that case: The standard case appears to correspond to C++11 mode. */
    9913         320 :     if (gcc_mode ? std_c99_inlining : cpp11_mode) {
    9914         320 :       (void)enter_predef_macro("1", "__GNUC_STDC_INLINE__",
    9915             :                                /*cannot_be_redefined=*/FALSE,
    9916             :                                /*ref_suppresses_pch_file=*/FALSE);
    9917             :     } else {
    9918           0 :       check_assertion(gpp_mode || gnu_c89_inlining);
    9919           0 :       (void)enter_predef_macro("1", "__GNUC_GNU_INLINE__",
    9920             :                                /*cannot_be_redefined=*/FALSE,
    9921             :                                /*ref_suppresses_pch_file=*/FALSE);
    9922             :     }  /* if */
    9923             :   }  /* if */
    9924         320 :   if (clang_mode) {
    9925           0 :     (void)enter_predef_macro("1", "__clang__",
    9926             :                              /*cannot_be_redefined=*/FALSE,
    9927             :                              /*ref_suppresses_pch_file=*/FALSE);

    9932             :                                                      CLANG_VERSION_STRING),
    9933             :                              "__clang_version__",
    9934             :                              /*cannot_be_redefined=*/TRUE,
    9935             :                              /*ref_suppresses_pch_file=*/FALSE);

    9937             :        __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__, __GNUG__, and __VERSION__ but those are static (and
    9938             :        based on a GNU version of 4.2.1) and aren't defined here (they can be
    9939             :        defined in a predefined_macros.txt file if so desired). */

    9962             : 
    9963        3520 : void set_predef_macro_mode(a_predef_macro_mode  mode,
    9964             :                            a_boolean            value)
    9965             : /*
    9966             : Set the entry in the predefined macro mode value table entry of "mode"
    9967             : to "value".
    9968             : */
    9969             : {
    9970        3520 :   predef_macro_mode_values[(int)mode] = value;
    9971        3520 : }  /* set_predef_macro_mode */
    9972             : 
    9973             : 
    9974             : static unsigned int last_mode_index = 0;
    9975             :                         /* Keep track of the index of the last predefined
    9976             :                            macro mode (since it's likely that the next
    9977             :                            predefined macro will have the same mode). */
    9978             : 
    9979             : 
    9980           0 : static a_boolean get_predef_macro_mode_value(char       *name)
    9981             : /*
    9982             : Return the value of the predefined macro mode associated with "name".
    9983             : A catastrophic error is issued if the mode name is invalid.
    9984             : */
    9985             : {
    9986           0 :   unsigned int          i;
    9987           0 :   a_predef_macro_mode   mode = pmm_none;
    9988             : 
    9989           0 :   if (last_mode_index != 0 &&
    9990           0 :       strcmp(name, predef_macro_mode_names[last_mode_index]) == 0) {
    9991             :     /* The mode is the same as the last one. */
    9992             :     mode = (a_predef_macro_mode)last_mode_index;
    9993             :   } else {
    9994             :     /* Look for the specified name in the mode names table. */
    9995           0 :     for (i = (int)pmm_none + 1; i < (int)pmm_last; ++i) {
    9996           0 :       if (strcmp(name, predef_macro_mode_names[i]) == 0) {
    9997           0 :         mode = (a_predef_macro_mode)i;
    9998           0 :         last_mode_index = i;
    9999           0 :         break;
   10000             :       }  /* if */
   10001             :     }  /* for */
   10002           0 :     if (mode == pmm_none) {
   10003             :       /* No matching name was found. */
   10004           0 :       str_catastrophe(ec_bad_macro_mode_name, name);
   10005             :     }  /* if */
   10006             :   }  /* if */
   10007           0 :   return predef_macro_mode_values[(int)mode];
   10008             : }  /* get_predef_macro_mode_value */
   10009             : 
   10010             : 
   10011           0 : static a_boolean process_predefined_macro_entry(char            *line,
   10012             :                                                 an_error_code   *error_code)
   10013             : /*
   10014             : Scan a predefined macro file entry.  The format is:
   10015             : 
   10016             : mode,!mode,mode   cannot_redefine   macro_name   macro_value
   10017             : 
   10018             : - "mode" is a label from the predefined macro modes table.  The macro is
   10019             :   defined if the mode is set, or if the mode is not set when "!mode" is
   10020             :   used.  The macro is defined if any of the mode tests is TRUE.
   10021             : 
   10022             : - cannot_redefine indicates whether the predefined macro may later be
   10023             :   redefined.  The value must be "yes" or "no".
   10024             : 
   10025             : - macro_name is the name of the macro to be defined.
   10026             : 
   10027             : - macro_value is the value to which the macro should be defined.  All of
   10028             :   the characters until the end of the line are used as the macro value.
   10029             : 
   10030             : An entry may also be empty (just whitespace).  A line that begins with
   10031             : a "#" is a comment and is ignored.
   10032             : 
   10033             : Return TRUE if the macro line was processed successfully, FALSE otherwise.
   10034             : When FALSE is returned, error_code points to a description of the error
   10035             : that occurred.
   10036             : */
   10037             : {
   10038           0 :   char          *ptr;
   10039           0 :   a_boolean     result = FALSE;

   11023             :   /* Do the initial allocation for macro_buffer.  (Since the space is

   11193         320 :   use_raw_version_of_arg = FALSE;
   11194         320 :   top_microsoft_slmp = NULL;
   11195         320 : }  /* macro_trans_unit_init */
   11196             : 
   11197             : 
   11198         320 : void macro_init(void)
   11199             : /*
   11200             : Initialize static variables related to macro processing that must be
   11201             : initialized for each compilation.
   11202             : */
   11203             : {
   11204             :   /* avail_macro_args is not per-compilation and should not be cleared. */
   11205         320 :   num_macro_invocations_in_process = 0;
   11206             : #if FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS
   11207         320 :   active_text_map_position_trackers = NULL;
   11208             : #endif  /* FULLY_RESOLVED_MACRO_POSITIONS */
   11209             : #if DEBUG
   11210         320 :   num_macro_params_allocated    = 0;
   11211         320 :   num_macro_defs_allocated      = 0;
   11212             :   /* num_macro_args_allocated is not per-compilation and should not be
   11213             :      cleared. */
   11214             :   /* macro_arg_text_space is not per-compilation and should not be
   11215             :      cleared. */
   11216         320 :   param_name_string_space       = 0;
   11217         320 :   macro_definition_space        = 0;
   11218             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   11219         320 : }  /* macro_init */
   11220             : 
   11221             : #if MAKE_FRONT_END_CALLABLE
   11222             : 
   11223         320 : void macro_cleanup(void)
   11224             : /*
   11225             : This routine is called at the end of compilation, or if compilation is
   11226             : terminated prematurely for some reason.  It performs any cleanup operations
   11227             : required.  In particular, it closes any files that may have been open at
   11228             : the point at which the compilation was terminated.
   11229             : */
   11230             : {
   11231         320 :   close_file_if_open(&f_predef_macros);
   11232         320 : }  /* macro_cleanup */
   11233             : 
   11234             : #endif /* MAKE_FRONT_END_CALLABLE */
